The traditional Chinese lunar calendar divides the year into 24 solar terms. Major Cold (Chinese: 大寒), the 24th solar term, begins this year on Jan 20 and ends on Feb 4.

Major Cold is the last solar term in winter and also the last solar term in the annual lunar calendar. In this period, snow, rain and icy cold weather exert a big influence on people's lives.

China's "iceman" Jin Songhao has won a snow bucket challenge after enduring an icy shower of 100 snow buckets that were poured over him in less than 100 minutes on Saturday.

Jin stripped to their shorts and endured buckets of snow being thrown at them in minus 20 degrees weather in Harbin City.

Luo is related to Ling Jihua, the senior Party official currently being probed for corruption.

Beijing railway authorities have installed 30 ticket vending machines across the city to facilitate the booking and fetching of train tickets before the Spring Festival travel peak.

A Chinese man in his 70s has been charged for a botched attempt to bomb a bus in Zhejiang Province, local prosecutors said on Tuesday.

The defendant, Wang, set off a grenade on a bus in the city of Jinhua, but the out-of-date explosive only caused a minor explosion that hurt nobody and caused no damage, the prosecutors said.

China and Japan resumed talks on Monday in Tokyo on establishing a maritime crisis management mechanism to prevent the outbreak of conflict in the East China Sea, with analysts saying that the meeting is an encouraging signal, but warning that disagreements over key principles remain.

Burqas are not traditional dress for Uygur women, and wearing them in public places is banned in countries such as Belgium and France.

Ganoderma lucidum, known as Lingzhi mushroom in China, is often used in traditional Chinese medicine. Because of its alleged health benefits, the lingzhi mushroom is highly prized and known as "the mushroom of immortality."

Six companies in east China's Jiangsu Province were ordered to pay US$ 26 million for discharging waste chemical to rivers by a court on Tuesday. It is the highest fine of its kind in China ever imposed.

China's top two bullet train makers, the China CNR Corp. and the CSR Corp. Limited will merge into a new company, according to a CSR Corp. announcement filed with the Shanghai Stock Exchange late on Tuesday.

Daqing Oilfield, the crown jewel of China's largest oil and gas producer and supplier by output China National Petroleum Corporation (CNPC), is reportedly having its production target trimmed down gradually from the current 40 million tons per year to 32 million tons per year by 2020.

The plan will be helpful for the company to make structural adjustments while the global crude oil price remains at a record-low.
Chinese cities of Beijing, Tianjin and those in the surrounding areas are once again shrouded in heavy smog that is expected to last until Tuesday night, the national observatory forecast on Sunday.
China's first overhead line service vehicle is unveiled. The equipment has a top speed of 160 km/h and is the most advanced one of its kind. It is also called the 'bullet train ambulance'.

An upgraded locomotive named after late Chinese leader Mao Zedong (1893-1976) starts carrying passengers on the line between Beijing to his home province of Hunan on December 25, 2014.

The train is scheduled to arrive in Changsha, capital of Hunan on Friday morning. Friday is the 121st anniversary of Mao's birth.

In the past 10 years, wetlands in China have reduced by 3.34 million hectares, an area nearly the size of South China's Hainan province.

Human activity and overexploitation are the main reasons for the degradation, and conflicts between wetland protection and economic-social development are severe.

A total of 42 people have been penalized over a fatal coal mine blast that claimed 27 lives in Huainan City in east China's Anhui Province on Aug. 19, the Anhui Coal Mine Safety Supervision Bureau has announced.

Photo taken on Dec 21, 2014 shows Masaya, a caldera located 20 km south of Managua, Nicaragua. It is Nicaragua's first and largest National Park. 

Masaya continually emits large amounts of sulfur dioxide gas.  It is the only volcano in the western hemisphere where you are able to drive to the rim. (Jimmy Ren)

PLA's Shenxianwan border post is located in the middle of Karakoram Mountains, #Xinjiang. The post is 5,380 meters above the sea level, the maximum temperature difference between the day and the night here is over 30 Celsius degrees, and it has more than 180 strong windy days a year. The oxygen content in the air is less than 45 percent of that of the inland.

A map that shows the most prevalent types of cancer by province in China has gone viral on the Internet, but health experts say it is fake. 

The map claims to be based on the results of a survey of 39,966 people, aged 18 to 60, in 25 provinces. It says there are 8,550 new cancer cases reported every day and that 6 people are diagnosed with cancer every minute.

China on Friday expressed resolute opposition to the signing by US President Barack Obama of a bill authorizing the sale of Perry-class guided missile frigates to Taiwan.

"The bill seriously violates the three China-US joint communiques, particularly the US commitments specified in the August 17 Communique," said Foreign Ministry spokesman Qin Gang.

The United States agreed to gradually reduce arms sales to Taiwan under the August 17 Communique signed in 1982.

China has the world's largest HSR network. A World Bank paper released Friday finds initial traffic volumes are promising, with traffic growing from 128 million trips in 2008 to 672 million trips in 2013.

In 2013, China's high-speed rail lines carried more passenger-kilometers (214 billion) than the rest of the world combined, about 2.5 times the volume in Japan and four times the volume in France.

Chinese Premier Li Keqiang receives a jersey of the Serbian national basketball team as a gift from Serbian Prime Minister Aleksandar Vucic in Belgrade, Serbia on Wednesday, December 17. The No 1 shirt features the premier's name on the back.
A Chinese tourist was killed and many others injured when a hot air balloon hard landed in central Turkey on Wednesday, according to the Chinese embassy in Turkey and private Dogan news agency.

According to a study entitled "GCC Trade and Investment Flows," China will be the largest export market for six Arab oil states of the Gulf Co-operation Council (GCC) countries by 2020. 

The six GCC countries are Saudi Arabia, Kuwait, Bahrain, Qatar, the United Arab Emirates and Oman.

Whooper swans look for food on the Liangchenghekou Wetland in Rizhao, east China's Shandong Province, Dec. 13. 

More than 50 species of birds came to the Liangchenghekou Wetland to spend winter this year thanks to the local authority's efforts to improve the ecological environment on the wetland in the past years.
Chinese Premier Li Keqiang meets with Russian Prime Minister Dmitry Medvedev in Astana, Kazakhstan, Dec. 15, 2014.

China and Kazakhstan agreed on Sunday to tap into the potential of hi-tech cooperation and further advance bilateral aerospace cooperation.

The two countries agreed to jointly establish a technical cooperation center and set up a joint working group to study bilateral cooperation in the aerospace sector.
Children play with snow in Jumla, Nepal on Dec 14. The falling temperature brought snowfall to the mountainous districts of Nepal. (Soraj Shahi)

Branches of China Post and various express parcel firms in China have processed a combined 70.51 million express packages, an increase of more than 40 percent from the same day the previous year, Saturday figures from the State Post Bureau revealed.

The figure is also more than twice the daily average of 33.09 million registered so far this year, said the bureau.

A college building in Shijiazhuang City, which resembles the magical Harry Potter school has been completed.

The building called "Cinderella's Castle" will be used as an animation industry base. It has cost $384 million.

A high court in Inner Mongolia will announce its verdict on Monday of a retrial case, involving a rape & murder 18 years ago. Hugjiltu, the defendant, was executed despite doubts over the evidence in 1996 after being convicted as the criminal.

Chinese President Xi Jinping said Saturday any denial of the Nanjing Massacre will not be allowed by the Chinese people and people loving peace and justice all over the world.

The Nanjing Massacre committed by Japanese aggressors was one of the three major massacres during the WWII. It was an atrocious anti-human crime and a dark page in the history of human being, Xi said while addressing a state ceremony for China's first National Memorial Day for Nanjing Massacre Victims.

"Anyone who tries to deny the massacre will not be allowed by history, the souls of the 300,000 deceased victims, 1.3 billion Chinese people and all people loving peace and justice in the world," Xi said.

"Hour of Code" Workshops aiming to inspire innovation and break down barriers of access to computer science were held on Thursday at Apple's retail stores in Beijing.

Apple Inc supports the global event for young students and teenagers as one of the major partners and corporate backers, providing Apple retail stores as venues around the world.

Governments and China Railways Corporation plan to invest 10 billion yuan ($1.61 billion) to build a Beijing-Tianjin-Hebei railway transportation company.

A common transportation card is expected to be used between Beijing, Tianjin and some major cities in Hebei province in 2017.

China is likely to cut retail fuel prices by about 490 yuan ($79) a metric ton from Friday, after the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries forecast lower global demand for crude in 2015.

Global demand for crude from OPEC members will slump to 28.92 million barrels per day in 2015, the lowest since the 27.05 million bpd needed in 2003, according to a monthly report published by the organization.
Maternal love is boundless. Qiu Yuanyuan, a 26-year-old hostess of Zhengzhou TV Station, gived up chemo to protect her unborn baby. She passed away on Dec 10, at baby's 100-day birthday.

Canals stretching over 1,400 km began diverting water on Friday from China's longest river, the Yangtze, directly to Beijing.

Australian photographer Peter Lik created a new world record by selling one of his pictures for US$ 6.5 million.

Named Phantom, the black and white picture shows a shaft of light cutting through a Arizona landscape and is reportedly the most expensive photograph ever sold, the ABC website said.
Students play basketball at a rural school in Dahua Yao Autonomous County, south China's Guangxi on December 8.

Bank of China has made a deal to buy a Manhattan office building for nearly $600 million.

The 28-floor glassed office block at the intersection of 40th Street and Sixth Avenue is to the south of the 1200-foot Bank of America tower. BOC may move its headquarters into this office building.

Five teenagers were crushed to death after a wall collapsed at a junior high school in east China's Anhui Province on Monday afternoon.

An unknown number of injured students have been rushed to hospital for emergency treatment. Investigation into the tragedy is under way.

A civilian fire station in Xidu community, east China's Shanghai has become the first non-military firefighting force in the city to win the prestigious National 119 Fire Service Award.

The station was established by government as part of efforts to groom civilian firefighting teams to replace armed forces that currently provide firefighting services.

In Shanghai, there are only 7,000 firefighting soldiers, which is insufficient for a city with 23 million residents.

China has the plans to train about 30,000 overseas Chinese teachers by the end of 2017, it was announced on Sunday on the 3rd World Chinese Language and Culture Education Conference.

There are 60 million overseas Chinese in about 200 countries and regions, and some 20,000 schools of Chinese language and culture overseas.

Beefeaters - sentinels of the Tower of London - are in line to be given a Chinese name by Chinese people.

The naming contest is part of an online campaign by Britain's tourism agency, which is inviting Chinese participants to name 101 quintessentially British items, people and places.

Costing 1.6 million pounds, the event is part of a broader campaign to attract more tourists from China.

A worker installs nameplates at the Tsunami Museum in Banda Aceh, Indonesia, Dec 6.

The China Railway Construction Corporation has finished laying track for Nigeria's first standard-gauge railway project.

The 180-kilometer railway links Nigeria's capital Abuja and the northwestern state of Kaduna with 9 stations and has a design speed of 150 kilometers.

The project has taken three years to finish at a cost of some 850-million US dollars.

Hong Kong's Chief Executive CY Leung issued a new statement Tuesday, rejecting the demands of the Occupy protesters, who have been demanding changes to the proposed plans for universal suffrage in the next election in 2017.

"Universal suffrage that is not in line with the basic law is impossible. Hong Kong is a legal society. We have to proceed according to the law. Political reforms must be based on the basic law and decisions made by the NPC Standing Committee."

22-year-old Javier Bolden, the second man convicted of murdering two University of South California (USC) graduate students from China during a robbery on April 11, 2012 was sentenced to life in prison without parole on Monday.

Bolden was convicted on Oct. 27 of two counts of first-degree murder for the killings of Ying Wu and Ming Qu, both aged 23 and studying electrical engineering at USC.

Indian and Chinese soldiers salute at the starting ceremony of the Hand-in-hand India-China Anti-Terrorism Joint Training Exercise in Pune, India, on Nov 17. The joint counterterrorism training exercise will last for ten days. (Zheng Huansong)

Yak Museum of Tibet, the first yak-themed museum in the world, opened to the public in Lhasa, capital of southwest China's Tibet Autonomous Region on Saturday.

Located in Luanping County, Hebei province, Jinshanling is the best preserved section of the Great Wall, with many original features. 

The earliest part of the wall was built in 1368, during the Ming Dynasty. What was once a method of defense has become a world famous paradise for photography enthusiasts.

A Long March-2C carrier rocket carrying the Yaogan-23 remote sensing satellite blasts off from the launch pad at the Taiyuan Satellite Launch Center in Taiyuan, capital of north China's Shanxi province, Saturday. 

The satellite will be used for scientific experiments, natural resource surveying, estimating crop yields and disaster relief. The launch marks the 198th flight of the Long March rocket series.

Chinese Vice Premier Liu Yandong sends off a Chinese medical team who are to leave for West Africa to help in the fight against #Ebola, at the Beijing Capital International Airport in Beijing, China, Friday.
Residents took part in the annual Tour of High Heels or stiletto race in celebration of the Shoe Festival in Marikina City, which is also known as the "shoe capital" of the Philippines.

China's new-type frigate Sanmenxia officially joins the service of the People's Liberation Army (PLA) Navy during a commissioning ceremony held at a military port in Zhoushan, Zhejiang province on November 13. The frigate was independently designed and produced by China.

Edmund Thomas Downie receives his long-term visa, also the first Chinese visa with 10-year validity to U.S. citizens, from Ruan Ping, Consul General at the Chinese Embassy in the U.S., in Washington D.C., Wednesday.

The 22nd Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation (#APEC) Economic Leaders' Meeting kicked off in Beijing Tuesday morning.

The meeting is expected to make four achievements, including the launch of the Free Trade Area of the Asia-Pacific (FTAAP) process; a statement on the 25th anniversary of the APEC; promotion of innovation, reforms and growth to seek new momentum for long-term development of the Asia-Pacific; a blueprint to lay a solid foundation for all-round connectivity in the Asia-Pacific.

A shadow puppet exhibition was held in Shijiazhuang, capital of north China's Hebei Province. 

Chinese shadow puppetry is a form of theatre whereby colorful silhouette figures perform traditional plays against a back-lit cloth screen, accompanied by music and singing. Puppeteers make the figures from leather or paper and manipulate them by means of rods to create the illusion of moving images.

Mexico decided to withdraw a high-speed rail deal with a China-Mexico joint consortium because of domestic factors, China's economic planner said on Saturday.

It had nothing to do with the Chinese enterprise and the Chinese government hopes that the case could be settled properly as soon as possible, said a spokesperson with the National Development and Reform Commission.
Visitors watch a fulldome film at the 11th Optics Valley of China International Optoelectronic Exposition in Wuhan, capital of central China's Hubei Province, November 6.

"Fox Hunt 2014," launched in July by China's Ministry of Public Security, aims to capture corrupt officials and suspects in economic crimes who have escaped abroad. By the end of October it had netted 180 suspects.

China's 21st Century Maritime Silk Route (MSR) policy has strong China's MSR has strong connections to the Sri Lankan President Mahinda Rajapaksa's economic policy framework that outlines aims to establish a maritime, commercial, knowledge and energy hub, Central Bank of Sri Lanka Governor Ajith Nivaard Cabraal said.

The government's policy makers have long insisted it was possible to use the island's strategic location in linking Europe and Africa with Asia. (file photo)

Workers on a boat try to clear away water hyacinth from the Huangpu River around the Bund in east China's Shanghai on Wednesday. 

The noxious river plant has been discovered in the Huangpu River near the Bund on Wednesday morning. City officials said the outbreak of the polluting plant came half a month later compared with previous years.

A court specializing in intellectual property rights (IPR) established in Beijing, capital of China on Thursday, in the latest effort to effectively handle IPR conflicts.

Chinese courts hear about 110,000 IPR cases annually and is seeing an continuous increase.

China began to renovate the former headquarters site of the notorious Japanese army unit 731 in the northeastern city of Harbin on Wednesday.

The renovation will last until August 30 next year. The project aims to not only renovate the museum but also coincides with the 70th victory anniversary of China's anti-Japanese war as well as the World Anti-fascist War next year. (file photo)

U.S. President Barack Obama on Wednesday said he was ready to work with Republicans who defeated Democrats and cruised to victory, becoming the majority party in both chambers of Congress after Tuesday's midterm election.
"Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles" dominated China's film market for the past opening weekend, bringing in 167 million yuan (27.3 million U.S. dollars).

The International Finance Corporation (IFC), a member of the World Bank Group, on Wednesday announced a package of 450 million U.S. dollars in commercial financing to support trade, investment and employment in three #Ebola affected Guinea, Liberia and Sierra Leone. (file photo)

Hubertus Troska, chairman and chief executive officer of Daimler Greater China, introduces Mercedes-Benz's new Sport Utility Coupe concept car G-Code at its unveiling event during the opening ceremony of the company's Mercedes-Benz research and development (R&D) center in Beijing on Monday.
Zhang Ping, vice chairman of the Standing Committee of the National People's Congress of China meets with Montenegro Prime Minister Milo Dukanovic in Podgorica, Montenegro, Nov. 3, 2014.
Beautiful scenery of advection fog in Shandong town
The registration center for the #APEC meeting in Beijing, capital of China was officially opened on Monday.

Chinese President Xi Jinping waving goodbye to tourists who are about to leave for Taiwan at the Pingtan Strait Ferry Terminal in Pingtan, southeast China's Fujian Province. 

Xi made an inspection tour to southeast China's Fujian Province on Nov. 1 and 2.

Chocolate skulls are shown during the opening of the Chocolate and Dead Bread Fair, in the framework of the celebrations of the Day of the Dead, in Mexico City, capital of Mexico, on October 30. 

On Thursday, the Chocolate and Dead Bread was inaugurated, as part of the celebrations of the Day of the Dead, where the biggest sugar skull of Mexico was presented, measuring 2.40m tall and 1.95m wide, weighing 600kg, made by Mexican artist Manuel Bueno.
"Ghosts" pose for photos in Happy Valley in Beijing on October 30.

China has lifted suspension on apples form Washington state, said the U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) Friday.

China suspended imports of red and golden delicious apples from Washington state in 2012 because of pests.

The Antares cargo rocket operated by private U.S. firm Orbital Sciences Corp. exploded 6 seconds after its liftoff at 6:22pm EDT on Tuesday in eastern Virginia, NASA TV showed.

There were no casualties reported. Investigation of the incident's cause is underway.
The "Golden Sea" which is located in northwest China's Qinghai Province, covers an area of 0.45 square kilometers. Two rivers originate from the lake.

A Long March 2C carrier rocket carrying the Shijian-11-08 experimental satellite leaves the launch pad at the Jiuquan Satellite Launch Center in Jiuquan, northwest China's Gansu Province, October 27. 

The Shijian-11-08 satellite will be used to conduct scientific experiments in space. The launch marks the 197th flight of the Long March rocket series.

Brazil's President and candidate for Workers Party, Dilma Rousseff, reacts after casting her ballot, in a polling station during the runoff of presidential elections, in Porto Alegre, Brazil, on October 26.
China's 4th space launch center in Wenchang, south China's Hainan province, will launch space station and cargo spacecrafts from 2017.

The APEC Economic Leaders' Meeting will be held in Beijing from Nov. 10 to 11. The APEC leaders' week will include the final senior officials' meeting from Nov. 5 to 6 and the 26th ministerial meeting from Nov. 7 to 8.

Liu Jinguo, Chinese vice-minister of public security, has been appointed deputy head of the 610 Office, which is also known as the central government agency responsible for combating cults and handling cult-related issues.

The 610 Office entered the public eye for the investigation of the case in which a woman was beaten to death on May 28, allegedly by six members of the illegal Church of Almighty God at a McDonald's in Zhaoyuan, north China's Shandong province.

Photo provided by Korean Central News Agency (KCNA) on October 24 shows top leader of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea (DPRK) Kim Jong Un providing field guidance to a drill between KPA Large Combined Unit 526 and KPA Combined Unit 478.
Ultraman series characters pose for photos at the 27th Tokyo International Film Festival in Tokyo, #Japan, Thursday
Photo shows Shenzhen No.3 People's Hospital training medical staffs how to use personal protection equipment to prevent the infection of #Ebola.

The local government in north China's coal-rich Shanxi province will invest more than 26 billion yuan (about 4.2 billion U.S. dollars) to fill in and restore vegetation to the subsidence areas caused by private coal mining, 

Statistics showed that three-fifths of the 5,000 square km of mined-out areas in the province have subsided and affected 2.3 million people.

China launched an unmanned spacecraft early Friday to test technologies to be used in the Chang'e-5, a future probe that will conduct the country's first moon mission with a return to Earth.

The lunar orbiter was launched atop an advanced Long March-3C rocket from the Xichang Satellite Launch Center in southwest China's Sichuan Province.

The test spacecraft separated from its carrier rocket and entered the expected the orbit shortly after the liftoff.

A cow is being worshipped during the religious ceremony of cow festival, the third day of Tihar festival, in Kathmandu, Nepal, October 23. 

"Tihar", the Hindu festival of lights, is celebrated for five days. Each day is dedicated to different religious figures including cow, crow, and dog, which signifies deep relations between human beings, god, and animals.
Photo shows the dried-up river bed of Chongling River of Guiyang, Hunan province. The city has been suffering from server drought since August this year.

Apple CEO Tim Cook met with Chinese Vice Premier Ma Kai on Wednesday and exchanged views on protection of users' information in Zhongnanhai, the central authority's seat.

In a letter to employees after the release of Apple's quarterly earnings report on this Monday, Cook disclosed his plan to meet with Apple store employees in Beijing.

Apple posted "the strongest revenue growth rate in seven quarters". Its revenue surged to $42.1 billion thanks to strong sales of its latest iPhones.
Chinese Finance Minister Lou Jiwei speaks at a joint press conference held by the APEC 2014 Finance Ministers' Meeting in Beijing, China, October 22.
Tihar is the Hindu festival of lights lasting for 5 days as people decorate their homes with garlands and decorative lights and greet each other with "Happy Tihar" or "Suva Dipawali".

China's basketball legend Yao Ming joins a 24-hour relay race in Beijing on October 18. 

Yao finished 3,500 meters in the first round and another 3,500 meters in the second round the next day. The former NBA star said it was the longest distance run he had attempted since retiring in 2011.
Beijing has launched a week-long etiquette training program for 2,280 volunteers serving at the APEC Economic Leaders' Week scheduled for early November.

China's economy for the first three quarters of this year has remained within a "reasonable range", Chinese Premier Li Keqiang said when meeting with delegations from the Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation (APEC) members for the finance ministers' meetings due on Wednesday.

Li hoped APEC finance ministers' meeting will explore the path for the economic transition in the region and advance practical cooperation, injecting new dynamism for the APEC cooperation.
Dust and sand borne by winds had swept over Kuwait on Monday.
A large amount of basalt columns was discovered in Zhangbei County, north China's Hebei province recently, which is considered to be formed in Miocene times.

The High Court of Hong Kong on Monday granted an interim injunction to bar #OccupyCentral protesters from continuing to occupy the section between Tim Mei Avenue and Lung Wui Road.

The application was filed by proprietors of the CITIC Tower, who complained that blocked roads have affected operations of emergency vehicles and threatened their safety.

Photo taken on Oct 18, 2014 shows the drum-shaped building in Hefei, capital of east China's Anhui Province. 

Measuring 18.13 meters in height with a diameter of 58.52 meters at its widest point, the building was granted the Guinness World Record of the largest building in the shape of a drum. (Zhang Duan)

Hong Kong Chief Executive CY Leung said on Sunday that China's central authorities are fully aware of Hong Kong's situation and have expressed confidence in him and the Hong Kong government to tackle the Occupy Central movement.

He also said that the Occupy Central movement is not entirely a domestic movement, as external forces are involved.

Hundreds of crabs escaped from a store which sells famous Yangcheng Lake Chinese mitten crabs in Nanjing, east China's Jiangsu Province in the early morning of Sunday, September 28. A staff of the store forgot to lock the door. Passersby helped to catch the crabs.

Colorful lanterns are seen at Tiehua Music Village in Taitung, southeast Taiwan, late September 28. 

Artists and locals made and painted some 3,000 hot-air-balloon-shaped lanterns this summer to decorate the nearby meadow of the village, echoing the annual balloon fiesta of the city.

The Chinese economy comprised about 12.3 percent of the world total in 2013, according to the National Bureau of Statistics (NBS) on Sunday.

China's GDP was USD 9.32 trillion in 2013. From 1953 to 2013, China's GDP increased 122 times at comparable prices, with annual average growth of 8.2 percent.

Lin Dan of China returns the shuttlecock during the men's singles quarterfinal of badminton against Tago Kenichi of Japan at the 17th Asian Games in Incheon, South Korea, September 27. Lin Dan won 2-0.

More than 24 million vehicles will be sold this year in the world's largest auto market, the China Association of Automobile Manufacturers (CAAM) has forecast on Friday.

China's vehicle output is also expected to top 24 million units this year, which will make the country the world's biggest car producer.
A man in Beijing, capital of China did planking for 4 hours and 26 minutes, breaking the Guinness World Record of an American who did for 3 hours and 7 minutes.

Policemen search mountainous woodlands for a man suspected of killing four primary school kids in Pingshan Town of Lingshan County, south China's Guangxi Zhuang Autonomous Region, September 26. 

Four primary school students were killed Friday morning in a knife attack on their way to Gupu Primary School. Three died at the scene and one died later in hospital. Police have identified the suspect as a 56-year-old local man surnamed Shi.

80-year-old Wu Siying plays the guitar and sings in front of his pancake stall in Pingyao, north China's Shanxi province on September 23. 

A keen music lover, Wu started to learn to play guitar by himself two years ago. The songs he plays and sings during intervals of his work are very popular among his customers.

Chinese authorities on Sept 22 urged more legal aid to soldiers and their families in a move to safeguard the rights and interests of military staff.

The scope of legal aid should be expanded to help soldiers and their dependents deal with civil disputes in daily life, and those facing financial hardship should be targeted. Staff with legal aid institutions are urged to improve their ability to provide high-quality service to soldiers. (file photo)
5 college students were arrested in Shenzhen, south China's Guangdong Province for smuggling 41 air pistols and around 3000 air pistol pellets.
This male elephant and black rhino from clash dramatically in a fearsome fight at a park in Africa.

Chinese President Xi Jinping met with Russian Federation Council Speaker Valentina Matviyenko in Beijing on Tuesday, calling for closer legislative cooperation between the two countries.

Matviyenko, chairwoman of the upper house of the Russian parliament, was in Beijing to co-chair the 8th meeting of a cooperation committee between China's National People's Congress (NPC) and the Russian Federation Council, with Zhang Dejiang, chairman of the NPC Standing Committee.
In order to improve fighting capacity of the army, People's Liberation Army Hong Kong Garrison holds adaptive training among soldiers.
Kan Wencong of China performs during the women's Changquan final of Wushu competition at the 17th Asian Games in Incheon, South Korea, September 23. Kan Wencong won the gold medal.

Green house is destroyed by rain storm at Gaotang Township of Xiangshan County, east China's Zhejiang Province, September 22. 

The 16th typhoon (tropical storm level) this year made the 4th landfall in Hepu Township of Xiangshan County in Zhejiang Province at 7:35 p.m. on Monday.
Chinese actress Yang Mi appears at Milan Fashion Week

The performance "walking on fire" was given in Pan'an county, East China's Zhejiang province on Sept 17. 

20 strong men walk through the fiery altar, measuring 10 meters in diameter. "Walking on fire" is a folk activity to ward off evil spirits and pray for safety, which has been listed as intangible cultural heritage by Zhejiang province.

Pan Yiyang, vice chairman of Inner Mongolia Autonomous Region government, has been removed from post for alleged law violations, the Organization Department of the Communist Party of China (CPC) Central Committee announced on Sunday.

A plan to make it easier for foreigners to obtain a Chinese green card is to be considered by the China (Shanghai) Pilot Free Trade Zone as part of trailblazing reform efforts to further open up and attract global talent.

"The zone can submit a reform plan to the central government with improvement suggestions for the convenient entry and stay of foreign talent," Li said on Thursday.

Members of the Chengdu Artistic Group of China, perform during a presentation in Panama City, capital of Panama, September 18. 

The presentation is part of the cultural activities to celebrate the upcoming 65th anniversary of the founding of the People's Republic of China.

A rescued worker receives medical treatment in the hospital in Chuxiong, southwest China's Yunnan Province, September. 

Four workers trapped in a tunnel collapse for four days were rescued on Friday. Rescuers are still searching for another two missing workers. The accident happened at about 9:30 a.m. on Monday in Chuxiong City after one of the support arches for the Guangtong-Dali railway renovation project collapsed.

A staff members shows the content of the newly-issued archives compilation of Chinese laborers forced to Japan at the Museum of the War of the Chinese People's Resistance Against Japanese Aggression, in Beijing, China, September 18. 

From 1943 to 1945, some 40,000 Chinese were captured and taken by the invaders to Japan, forcing them to work in mines and construction sites. A total of 6,830 died due to the ruthless exploitation, according to the data from Japan.
Chinese President Xi's wife Peng Liyuan on Thursday demonstrated Chinese calligraphy when visiting Tagore International School, #India

According to a bluebook on the development and management of Chinese cities, nearly 90% of China's urban centers are under unhealthy development, including Beijing and Tianjin.

Although Beijing is No.3 on the overall ranking, its environment ranks No. 206, one of the worst in Chinese cities, and its management ranks No. 85.

Only 23 cities, including Shenzhen, Shanghai, Suzhou and Dalian, can be considered as "healthy" cities, less than 10% of the total city number.

A black snub-nosed monkey sits on a tree branch in the Baimang Mountain National Natural Reserve in the Tibetan Autonomous Prefecture of Deqen in southwest China's Yunnan Province, September 16. 

The population of black snub-nosed monkeys within the area has expanded by about 50 as of September. In August 2013, a 5.1-magnitude earthquake in Deqen had exerted adverse effects to the habitats of black snub-nosed monkeys.

Taiwan government on September 17 announced tougher punishments for breaches of food safety regulations following the latest food safety scandal.

Fines will be raised tenfold to punish such violations, with the penalty fees in lethal cases reaching a maximum of $6.63 million.

Violators will face a maximum of seven years in prison instead of the previous five-year sentence. In cases where people die because of adulterated food, the culprits could receive a life sentence.

It's confirmed that China's first shale gas field has over 100 billion cubic meters of proven reserves.

The Ministry of Land and Resources says the field, which is located in Southwest China's Chongqing municipality, is highly productive, with daily output at each gas well exceeding 100,000 cubic meters.

According to experts, the recoverable shale gas reserve in China totals 25 trillion cubic meters in total.

Photo taken on September 16 shows road signs blown down by Typhoon Kaimaegi in Fangchenggang City, south China's Guangxi Zhuang Autonomous Region. 

The fifteenth Typhoon Kaimaegi hit Guangxi on Tuesday, affecting about 294,700 local residents and forcing the relocation of 25,800 people.

Founder and chairman of Alibaba Group Ma Yun gestures during a roadshow in Singapore, September 16. 

Alibaba is promoting its upcoming initial public offering in New York. At $21.76 billion, Alibaba would have the largest U.S. IPO of all-time, plus the largest tech IPO of all-time.

China's largest producer of offshore oil and gas CNOOC on September 15 said that CNOOC 981, the country's first deepwater drilling rig, has made its first deepwater gasfield discovery in the South China Sea.

The Lingshui 17-2 gasfield, some 150 kilometers south of Hainan Island, has an average operational water depth of 1,500 meters.

The well would produce 56.5 million cubic feet of gas per day, equivalent to about 9,400 barrels of liquid oil per day.
Best photos of the week: An Indian Kashmiri man crosses over flood waters with the use of a rope in Srinagar on September 9. (Xinhua)

Chinese President Xi Jinping and Tajik President Emomali Rahmon attend the completion ceremony of first-phase project of the Dushanbe No.2 power plant and the groundbreaking of second-phase  in Dushanbe, Sept. 13(Huang Jingwen)

Visiting Chinese President Xi Jinping and his Tajik counterpart Emomali Rahmon on Saturday attended the construction commencement ceremony of the Tajikistan section of Line-D of the China-Central Asia Gas Pipelines.

The 1000-km-long Line-D will run from Turkmenistan across Uzbekistan, Tajikistan and Kyrgyzstan to China, with an expected delivery capacity of 30 billion cubic meters (bcm) of natural gas every year once construction is completed in 2016.
The World Trade Center Tribute in Lights was seen on Thursday, September 11 in New York City, the United States, in memorial of the 13th anniversary of 9/11 #terrorism attack.

A foreign tourist learns how to process fengdou, a type of Chinese herb at Shanghai's Yuyuan Garden as part of a celebration of intangible cultural heritage and time-honored brands on September 10. 

The event is part of the Shanghai Tourism Festival, which starts on Saturday and runs through October 6. Visitors will be able to learn traditional arts such as lantern making and cooking steamed buns, while a variety of other activities will also be on show during the festival.

Premier Li Keqiang said China can meet the major economic goals this year and policymakers will not be distracted by short-term fluctuations of individual indicators.

Li downplayed the importance of some economic data from the past two months when delivering his keynote speech to the 2014 Summer #Davos, which opened Wednesday, September 10 in north China's port city of Tianjin. 

The forum will discuss diverse issues including China's economic outlook, shifts in finance and energy sectors and infrastructure.

Dancers perform during a ceremony of Pujawali in Bogor of West Java Province, Indonesia, Sept. 9. 

Pujawali is a Hindu ritual ceremony to mark the Parahyangan Agung Jagatkartta Taman Sari Salak Mountain, the second largest Pura (Hindu house of worship) after Pura Besakih at Bali.

The U.S. government will provide an additional 10 million U.S. dollars to help combat the #Ebola outbreak in West Africa, bringing its commitment against the unprecedented epidemic to more than 100 million dollars.

The new funds will support the African Union's (AU) urgent deployment of about 100 medical workers to Liberia, Guinea, Nigeria and Sierra Leone to manage and run Ebola treatment units that isolate and treat those affected.
Chinese President Xi Jinping meets with U.S. President Barack Obama's National Security Advisor Susan Rice in Beijing, capital of China, Sept. 9.

Harvard University on September 8 received the largest donation in its history of US$350 million from Ronnie and Gerald Chan, owners of Hong Kong real estate developer Hang Lung Group. The donators' business also include Morningside Group, a private equity and venture capital firm.

The donation has been directed to the School of Public Health in Harvard University. The school will be renamed after the Chan brothers' father T.H. Chan, who was also the founder of Hang Lung.

Chinese vice premier Wang Yang reiterated on Monday that the country will stick to its opening-up policy and continue to welcome foreign investment.

Wang pointed out that instead of fixating on China's favorable policies, foreign businesses should value a fair market and legal environment more.

The remarks came amid concerns that China's attitude towards foreign firms may be changing following its anti-corruption probe against GlaxoSmithKline (GSK), and anti-monopoly investigations against Microsoft, Jaguar Land Rover, and Qualcomm.

China successfully launched Yaogan-21 remote sensing satellite into orbit from Taiyuan Satellite Launch Center in north China's Shanxi Province on Monday, September 8.

Also launched in this mission was the Tiantuo-2 satellite, designed and built by the National University of Defense Technology and carried by Long March-4B rocket.

Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi said on September 6 in a press conference during his visit to New Zealand that China hopes a permanent truce to be implemented within Ukraine, which is in line with fundamental and long-term interests of Ukrainian people. 

The dispute between Ukraine and Russia needs a political solution as well, he said, noting that China hopes to see Ukraine-Russia relations back onto the right track.

China and Pakistan have agreed to postpone President Xi Jinping' state visit to Pakistan, which was scheduled to take place later this month, a Foreign Ministry spokesperson said on Saturday. (file photo)

Children show their moon cakes at the temporary resettlement in quake-hit Longtoushan Township of Ludian County, southwest China's Yunnan Province, Sept. 5. 

The Mid-Autumn Festival, which falls on Sept. 8 this year, is a traditional Chinese holiday during which families reunite. A 6.5-magnitude earthquake jolted Ludian on Aug. 3, killing more than 600 people and destroying 80,000 homes.

The 40-day-old panda twins  "Maoge" and "Maomei" in Chengdu Research Base of Giant Panda Breeding.

The brother "Maoge" is 1.53 kg and the sister "Maomei" is 1.44 kg. They are expected to open their eyes for the first time on Friday
China has established five P3 labs that can detect #Ebola or diagnose any suspected cases within 3-5 hours, the Chinese Center for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) said on Wednesday.(Carol)

Growth with crisis: Beijing has 21 million residents, almost the same population as Australia. Overpopulation problem results in hitting 2/3 of the annual water usage gap, report released by Beijing's municipal bureau of statistics shown.

Fingerprint payment debuts in Beijing

Instead of taking out her credit card for the spent on her lunch, Wang Dan, who works in Beijing, pressed her fingers to machine pads, sorting the bill of restaurant in a second.

Just this week, China's largest payment platform #Alipay and telecommunications giant #Huawei launched the fingerprint payment service on its Alipay Wallet app.
An 8-meter-tall Snoopy balloon and thousands little ones are seen on display in Shanghai Wednesday before the Chinese Mid-Autumn Festival.
Tourists in Tianjin City had unique celebration for the upcoming Mid-Autumn Festival at the an Ocean World.

A bridge in Zhengzhou City, Henan Province saw sinkholes 11 times in 5 months, with latest one on Sept. 2.  

Officials from local authority always said they will resolve the problem immediately but never do it.

Bai Enpei, Deputy Chief of the Environmental Protection and Resources Conservation Committee of the National People's Congress, has been dismissed from office for severe disciplinary violations, says the Organization Department of the CPC Central Committee.

Bai Has served as party secretary of Qinghai Province and Yunnan Province.

China has cleared its first drug for the treatment of Ebola to be used by its army. The drug, named 'JK-05' was developed by the Academy of Military Medical Sciences. 

The research team spent the last five years studying Ebola's prevention and treatment, and the drug has shown anti-Ebola activity during cell experiments and testing. It also recently completed pre-clinical testing as well as a clinical-safety evaluations. However, so far the drug has only been cleared for use in emergency situations.

Picture shows magma along a 1-km-long fissure in a lava field north of the Vatnajokull glacier, which covers part of Bardarbunga volcano system, August 29, 2014. Iceland has raised the aviation color-code to red.

Wang Jianlin (center), chairman of Wanda Group, Pony Ma (right), Tencent's CEO, and Robin Li, chairman and CEO of Baidu, pose for the cameras in south China's Shenzhen on August 29 after the announcement of a 5 billion yuan (US$814 million) e-commerce joint venture. 

Wanda, facing shrinking retail sales at brick and mortar stores, will hold a majority of 70% stake in the new company, Wanda E-Commerce Co, with Baidu and Tencent taking 15% each. Wanda hopes to turn customers at its stores into online shoppers.

Islamic State (IS) militants killed more than 160 Syrian soldiers in Syria, according to online video footage published on August 28. 

Also on Thursday, U.S. President Barack Obama acknowledged that a decision had not been made on whether to launch airstrikes against the IS militants in Syria, but he has asked his administration to prepare a range of military options.

Red construction hoardings are seen set up around the Tiananmen Gate Tower which is under repair in Beijing on August 27. 

It was the first time that the red-colored temporary fences, rather than the commonly seen green ones were applied in renovation project for the tower. Those red hoardings were used to make sure the repairing work would not affect the external appearance of the building.

Manchester United striker Wayne #Rooney has been named the new England captain by manager Roy Hodgson prior to their international friendly against Norway on September 3.

The 28-year-old, who became the skipper of his club two weeks ago by manager Louis van Gaal, replaced Liverpool's Steven Gerrard, who announced his retirement from the national team after the Brazil World Cup.

The President of the International Olympic Committee Thomas Bach waves the Olympic Flag during the closing ceremony of Nanjing 2014 Youth Olympic Games in Nanjing, capital of east China's Jiangsu Province, Aug. 28.
The national flag of People's Republic of China is raised during the closing ceremony of Nanjing 2014 Youth Olympic Games in Nanjing, capital of east China's Jiangsu Province, Aug. 28.
A 6.3 kg giant baby was born by C-section in North China's Shanxi Province, his weight equal to average 3-month-old boy. (XHNews)

Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesperson Qin Gang on Wednesday, August 27 urged the Japanese side to take tangible actions to remove obstacles to bilateral relations.

Qin said in a statement that China has not changed its consistent and clear stance on improving and developing China-Japan relationship. 

Qin's remarks came after former Japanese Prime Minister Yasuo Fukuda on Wednesday said there was a need for the leaders of the two countries to hold talks on the sidelines of the meetings of the Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation forum to be held in November in Beijing. （File photo shows former Japanese Prime Minister Yasuo Fukuda.）

Peng Shuai of China celebrates after defeating Agnieszka Radwanska of Poland during the 2014 US Open women's singles match at the USTA Billie Jean King National Tennis Center August 27 in New York. Peng won 6-3, 6-4.

Beijing is cracking down on illegal operation of motorcycles, motor tricycles and electric tricycles to improve road safety.

The authorities will confiscate vehicles without license plates and detain anyone driving without a license.

Official statistics show since July this year, traffic accidents caused by motorcycles, motor tricycles and electric tricycles in Beijing soared to 70 from 40 in 2013, leaving 78 dead.

Xing Guangmei, the first female spokesperson of China People's Liberation Army Navy debuted in press conference of 120th anniversary of Sino- Japanese War memorial ceremony on August 26 in Weihai, east China's Shandong Province. Xing is also the only spokeswoman of PLA for now.

Chinese Premier Li Keqiang on Tuesday, August 26 promised visiting Zimbabwean President Robert Mugabe that China will continue to support the development of Zimbabwe and Africa as a whole.

Li said that China will transfer technologies adapted to Zimbabwe, help it increase food supply, promote poverty reduction and construct infrastructure, and cooperate on personnel training to boost the country's production and national development.

He also expressed willingness to consolidate political mutual trust with Zimbabwe.

3-year old Wang Keran kisses her father Wang Zhihua before discharged from a children's hospital in Taiyuan City, north China's Shanxi Province after recovering from a rare condition. 

The single father had to carefully chew food before passing it to his daughter for more than 18 months as the girl suffered from achalasia, a disorder of muscles that results in difficulty in swallowing. With donations, the girl who weighed just 7 kilograms had a successful surgery on August 5.
Fire fighters try to douse a major fire which broke out at a building in Cannaught Place in New Delhi, India, Aug. 25. The number of casualty is unknown.

The White House confirmed the release of American journalist Peter Theo Curtis (photo) who had been held captive in Syria since October 2012.

The Islamic State threatened to kill more American hostages after the beheaded U.S. journalist James Foley as avenge ongoing U.S. airstrikes on its targets in northern Iraq. U.S. special operations troops in Syria failed to locate American hostages including Foley this summer.

The Gate of the Orient, 301.8 metres (990 ft) high, is a US$700 Million skyscraper in Suzhou City, east China. 

Construction has been delayed by a decade-long. The developer is reported to have a debt to income rato of 80 percent. It may not be completed in 2014 as planned.

A girl threw her bag in her foreign boyfriend's face after being told that her luxury bag, a gift from her boyfriend, was fake during a luxury goods appraising activity in Beijing, capital of China, August 23.

China invested a total of 30 billion yuan (4.87 billion U.S. dollars) on water infrastructure projects in the Tibet Autonomous Region in the last two decades, data from the Ministry of Water Resources showed on August 23.

More than 1,000 projects have been organized by the ministry. The facilities provided safe drinking water for 2.39 million people, and the works also brought electricity to about 360,000 herdsmen.

Photo shows Manla Reservoir in  Gyangze County, southwest China's Tibet Autonomous Region.

Soldiers from Russia participate in the joint military exercise before the "Peace Mission-2014" in Zhurihe, north China's Inner Mongolia Autonomous Region, Aug. 21. 

The "Peace Mission-2014" will run from Aug. 24-29. The drill, which will involve over 7,000 personnel from China, Russia, Kazakhstan, Kyrgyzstan and Tajikistan, is expected to hone multilateral decision-making, sharpen joint anti-terror efforts and boost intelligence sharing to ensure regional peace and stability.

According to the coordinator, the upcoming 2014 Summer Davos in North China's Tianjin will feature more Chinese topics including Confucius research and Chinese pop art, as local organizers take a more active role in the annual event. The three-day meeting will open in Tianjin on Sept 10.

Established by World Economic Forum since 207, Summer Davos creates an opportunity for exchange between leaders in governments, media, academia and civil society.
Chinese President Xi Jinping (R) meets with #Mongolia's Prime Minister Norov Altankhuyag in Ulan Bator, Mongolia, Aug. 22.

A unique scene of "Yin-Yang river" is seen in Shaoxing, east China's Zhejiang Province. Inside of the wall is the East Lake scenic area where the water is relatively clear and greenish, while behind the wall runs the muddy water from the East Zhejiang ancient canal section of the famous Yellow River.

Sakari Momol, at the age of 111 years, 192 days, becomes the world's oldest living man since the death of 111-year-old Alexander Imich on June 8, 2014.  

Sakari was born on February 5, 1903. He lives in Fukushima Prefecture, Japan.

Chinese President Xi Jinping and his wife Peng Liyuan are greeted by Mongolian Prime Minister Norov Altankhuyag and his wife at the airport in Ulan Bator, Mongolia, Aug. 21. Xi arrived in Ulan Bator Thursday for a two-day state visit to Mongolia.

A 8-year-old boy on Wednesday, August 20 imitated a scene in Tom and Jerry, putting an ignited firework into a shotgun. 86 bullets shot at his face following an explosion. Wed imitated a scene in Tom & Jerry putting an ignited firework into a shotgun; 86 bullets shot at his face. The boy has been sent to ICU of Shanghai Ninth People's Hospital.

Former U.S. President George W. #Bush has joined a growing list of celebrities across the world to take the #icebucketchallenge to help raise money for Amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (#ALS) patients and has nominated his predecessor Bill #Clinton to do it next.

Chloe Beaucarne of Belgium competes during the Women's 100m Hurdles Qualification match of athletics event at the Nanjing 2014 Youth Olympic Games in Nanjing, capital of east China's Jiangsu Province, on August 20.

A staff attends a medical drill in a negative-pressure isolation ward which can be used to accommodate #Ebola virus disease (EVD) patients at Shandong Provincial Thoracic Hospital of Jinan, capital of east China's Shandong Province, Aug. 20. 

Authorities in Shandong recently made Shandong Provincial Thoracic Hospital the province's designated medical service institution for potential EVD cases. The hospital has taken a series of precautionary measures against the disease, which has already caused over 1,000 deaths in West Africa this year.

Yang Shiguang, 78, is a member of the "Unique skills team of Xi'an". He started to practice handstand, Rougong (a Chinese Kong fu) and Yoga at the age of 70, and now he is very famous for his stunning skills.

China's National Development and Reform Commission announced that 12 Japanese auto parts manufacturers, including Hitachi, Mitsubishi Electric, Nachi-Fujikoshi, were fined US$200 million for antitrust violations. (file photo)
Indian activists of leftist women's organizations block the traffic to protest against the recent rape and murder in Calcutta, capital of eastern Indian state West Bengal, Aug. 19.

Afghan President Hamid Karzai (C) speaks during the celebration of Afghan Independence Day in Kabul, Afghanistan, Aug. 19. 

Afghanistan marked the 95th anniversary of its independence from the British occupation on Tuesday.

Rescuers prepare to go into the Dongfang Coal Mine in Xiejiaji District of Huainan City, east China's Anhui Province, Aug. 19. 

27 people remain trapped after a blast occurred in the Dongfang Coal Mine early Tuesday, rescuers said. Rescue work is under way and the cause of the accident is being investigated.

Chinese President Xi Jinping on August 17 meets with Prince Albert II of Monaco who was to attend the opening ceremony of the 2014 Summer Youth Olympic Games in Nanjing, capital of east China's Jiangsu Province.
Gold medalist Jiang Huihua of China competes in the women's weightlifting 48kg of Nanjing 2014 Youth Olympic Games in Nanjing, capital of east China's Jiangsu Province, on Aug. 17.

A couple attends an underwater wedding ceremony at the whale sharks' aquarium of Chimelong Ocean Kingdom in Zhuhai city of south China's Guangdong province on August 14. 

The newly-weds, from Guangzhou, are both diving enthusiasts with professional certificates.

Dozens of students participate in the Junior Mountie Police Academy to learn about the knowledge of policing that organized by Royal Canadian Mounted Police (RCMP) which has started on August 13 in Coquitlam, Canada. 

During the 4-day camp, the children are participating in training and experiencing different policing scenarios.

Quarantine staff members fill up questionary for four passengers who came from ＃Ebola-infected Nigeria at the Beijing Capital International Airport in Beijing, capital of China, Aug. 14. 

To prevent the deadly Ebola virus from entering China, China's quarantine authority implements stricter inspections on inbound flights from regions affected by Ebola and step up sanitary measures on incoming goods.

Rescuers entered the flooded well of the Anzhishun Coal Mine at the Chengzihe district of Jixi,in northeast China's Heilongjiang Province, early on Aug. 15. 

23 people have been trapped after the coal mine was flooded in Jixi City on Aug. 14.

Local police seized 10.7 tons of "poisonous bean sprouts" which were processed by prohibited chemicals including bleaching powder and sodium hydrosulphite in Wuhan, central-east China's Hubei Province on August 14. 

These additives, while perfecting the appearance and retaining the freshness of bean sprouts, are also harmful to human health.

Russian President Vladimir Putin said Thursday that his country will spare no efforts to facilitate an earliest end of the conflict in southeastern Ukraine.

"A large-scale humanitarian catastrophe is running riot in the southeast (Ukraine) as thousands of people have died and hundreds of thousands become refugees," Putin told a meeting with Russian lawmakers in Crimea's resort city of Yalta.

Putin urged the parliamentarians to strengthen unity within Russian society, saying the country should not shield itself from the outside world.

A man in Zibo, East China's Shandong province, won a lottery with RMB 497million (USD 80.76 million) bonus. 

The winner came to the Sports Lottery Center in Shandong in a Mickey Mouse costume to claim the prize on August 11. He also established a "Well-doer Fund" with RMB 20million (USD 3.25 million) to help people in need.

42 performing groups and agents in Beijing, capital of China has jointly signed letter of commitment on Wednesday, August 13, vowing never to hire performance personnel who are drug abusers.

According to Beijing Municipal Anti-Drug Office, Beijing has more than 20,000 registered drug addicts.  Drugs have caused more than US$3.25 billion financial losses to Beijing annually.

China's amphibious landing ship Changbaishan and frigate Yuncheng of the 18th escort fleet of Chinese Navy arrived in Colombo of Sri Lanka on Tuesday, August 12. 

The two ships will stay here a day before they finish their mission in the Somali waters.
Beautiful actress Yuan Quan shows for cover pictures of fashion magazine.

Russian organizers released rankings of the second phase of 2014 Tanks Biathlon World Championship. 

China's 96A tank has climbed to fourth place. Russia's T-72B3M tank secured the first place at this stage.
Indian villagers wade through water at the flooded Kendrapara district in Orissa, India, Aug. 9.

South Korean photographers and artists march through downtown district in memorial of the victims of the ferry ＃Sewol disaster in Seoul, South Korea, Aug. 11.

The sinking of the ferry Sewol on April 16 killed more than 300 passengers on board, most of them were high school students.

Fang Xiping, Secretary of Huainan Municipal Committee of the CPC in east China's Anhui Province, is under probe for severe deciplinary violations by Anhui Provincial Committee for Discipline Inspection.

His position is the highest official in charge the city.

Villager Zhang Hongwei and his wife were dragged away from home at midnight by a bunch of strangers in Xinzheng, central China's Henan Province on August 9. They were under these strangers' control for several hours and were thrown in a graveyard.

The couple found their house ruined in those several hours when they arrived home. Zhang's wife burst out crying on the ruins.
Street snap of Gao Yuanyuan in Europe

Update: State TV of #Iran reported that 48 people were killed and 3 others seriously burned. 

An Iranian passenger plane crashed Sunday while taking off from an airport near Tehran,40 people were feared killed.

The aircraft is an Iran-141 jet.  Iran's state-run IRNA news agency reported the plane went down in a residential area.

Police in Sanming City, Fujian Province have seized thousands of pounds of sow meat which was sold as beef by local vendors. 

After cutting off fat and fascia, sow meat looks almost the same as beef , however the price increased five times.

A matador performs during a traditional Portuguese bullfight at Lisbon's Campo Pequeno bullring, Portugal, Aug. 7. 

Portuguese bullfighting is different and far less gory than the Spanish version where the bull is stabbed to death if the matador manages to win the contest.
500 children participated in a national chess tournament in Xi'an, northwest China's Shaanxi Province on Friday, August 8, playing chess, international chess and the game of Go.

Yunnan #Earthquake: Volunteers on prepared breakfast at a temporary resettlement on August 7. 230,000 people have been resettled since the earthquake hit Ludian County, southwest China's Yunnan Province.

Photo shows a 30-meter high giant garbage mountain in Shijiazhuang, north China's Hebei Province. Local residents said the rubbish mountain has been there for decades. 

The village committee is currently leading negotiation with environmental technology companies to find the solution.

The United Nations flag flies at half mast at the organization's New York headquarters on Aug. 7, in honor of the UN staff members killed in Gaza Strip since the start of the conflict almost a month ago.

The Chinese government has passed a regulation that requires users of instant messaging services to use real names when registering in an effort to hold users responsible for content.

Users shall abide by laws and regulations, the socialist system, national interests, the legitimate rights and interests of citizens, public order, social morality and ensure the authenticity of the information they provide, the regulation states.

The new rule follows a series of efforts by the government to clean up cyberspace and maintain Internet order as social media platforms are gaining popularity in China.
Yunnan #Earthquake: Helicopter from Chengdu Military Aviation Brigade successfully dropped food and water in quake-hit areas.

Sheep graze in the dried-up Longwei Reservoir in Qianjing Town of Yuzhou City, central China's Henan Province, Aug. 5. 

Lasting drought in Henan has led to the drop of streamflow of rivers, left 35% of the medium and small-sized reservoirs dried up and affected 740,000 people and 100,000 cattles.

Chang Chenshu looks at her newly-born child in Ludian People's hospital in southwest China's Yunan province on Aug 5. 

Chang was rescued after being covered under the ruins for one hour two days before the delivery. "We call the baby "earthquake baby", said Fei Ning, a nurse from the hospital.

A United States Army major general was killed on Tuesday by an Afghan soldier, shot at close range at a military training academy on the outskirts of Kabul, U. S. media reported.

The officer was the highest-ranking member of the American military to have died in hostilities in the Afghanistan war, according to The New York Times.

An unspecified number of other service members of the American- led coalition and Afghan soldiers, including a senior Afghan commander, also were shot.(file photo)
A young girl dances on the Seventeen Arch Bridge in the Summer Palace in Beijing, capital of China, Aug. 4.

Yunnan #earthquake: Total donation to disaster zone has reached RMB 200 million (USD 32.34 million) on August 5. 

The Civil Affairs Department has allocated more than 30,000 temporary tents to Ludian County, southwest China's Yunnan Province. 

Weather forecast sees heavy rainfall in the next three days, which may increase the difficulty of disaster relief and rescue.

Chinese Premier Li Keqiang comforts a child at the earthquake zone in southwest China's Yunnan Province, Aug. 4. 

Premier Li Keqiang walked into Longtoushan Township of Ludian County Monday to examine the situation of the earthquake and instruct the quake relief work.

A 3-year-old girl watches over a meat booth at Pangu Agricultural Market in Nanning, capital of south China's Guangxi Zhuang Autonomous Region, Aug. 2. 

During summer vocation, vendors in markets have to bring their kids to work since it is difficult to find a place, both accessible and affordable,  to take care the children.

Residents donate blood on a voluntary blood donation vehicle in Nantong, east China's Jiangsu Province, Aug. 2, 2014. 

The explosion has killed 69 people and injured more than 180 others after ripping through a factory in Kunshan City of Jiangsu Province on Saturday morning. Residents here gather to donate blood to support treating the injured.

China's civil aviation authority will from Friday abort control measures in place for flights in the country's eastern, central and southern regions while a military exercise goes on in southeast coastal areas, it announced on Thursday.

After flight delays attributable to the controls, the Civil Aviation Administration of China said that flights in these regions will return to normal operation once the controls are removed.

Five frontier guards and their partners hold group wedding in front of a Chinese boundary monument, which is 5100 metres above sea level, in northwest China's Xinjiang Uyghur Autonomous Region, July 30.

Police in Guangdong province raid three sites producing fake banknotes and seize more than RMB 92.7 million  (USD 15 million) in counterfeit currency, according to a press conference held by Police on July 30. 

Also seized was sophisticated equipment including computers, film, scanners, pattern plates and many unfinished banknotes.

Palestinians inspect the damage of Al-Sousi mosque that was destroyed in an Israel strike, at the Shati refugee camp, in the northern Gaza City, on July 30. 

The death toll in the Gaza Strip since a large-scale Israeli offensive started on July 8 has risen to 1,306 on Wednesday, with more than 7,000 wounded, Gaza Health Ministry spokesman Ashraf al-Qedra said.
A boy sits at a mosque in Xi'an, capital of northwest China's Shaanxi Province, July 30. Muslims in Xi'an celebrated Eid al-Fitr Wednesday, which marks the end of the Islamic holy month of Ramadan.
Armed policemen of the third detachment of Shanghai Armed Police Corps take part in a combat exercises in Shanghai, east China, July 30.

Tan Li, vice governor of south China's island province of Hainan, was removed from his position on Wednesday, according to local government.

The Central Commission for Discipline Inspection of the Communist Party of China (CPC), the CPC's anti-graft body, announced on July 8 that Tan was under investigation for suspected "serious law and discipline violations."
Canadian Cale Klesko stretches and warms up his muscles with help from his friends before a kung fu class in the 1,500-year-old Shaolin Temple in Henan province.

People board the ferry leaving for their hometowns for the upcoming festival Eid al-Fitr in Dhaka, Bangladesh, July 25. 

Local Muslims prepare to celebrate the festival which marks the end of the fasting month of Ramadan.
Dancing with sharks deep in the sea

The Islamic Hamas movement has agreed on a 12-hour ceasefire in the Gaza Strip starting from 8 am Saturday morning which proposed by the United Nations , a Hamas official said late on Friday night, July 25.

It's the second pause of fighting since Israel and Hamas fighters started their fierce cross-border violence on July 8.

Wing Chun master Tu Tengyao teaches students in southwest China's Chongqing. He has more than 80 students from all walks of life, with the age varied from 8 to 50.

Wing Chun is a concept-based Chinese martial art and form of self-defense. It teaches practitioners to advance quickly and strike at close range.

A little girl takes a train to go back to her hometown at Pasar Senen train station in Jakarta, Indonesia, July 24. 

Muslims across Indonesia move from major cities to their hometowns to celebrate the Muslim's Eid al-Fitr festival on July 28 and 29, which marks the end of the fasting month of Ramadan.

Police officers reinforce dikes in De'an County, east China's Jiangxi Province, July 24. 

One person had been confirmed dead while two others missing as typhoon Matmo hit the county. Over 100,000 local residents were affected by the typhoon.

Palestinian medics treat a boy who was wounded by Israeli shelling at a hospital in the town of Khuza'a, east of Khan Younis, southern Gaza Strip, on July 24. 

The death toll of the ongoing Israeli offensive in the Gaza Strip has climbed to 733, Palestinian medical sources said on Thursday. More than 4,600 others were wounded.
People eat hot dogs during the annual Capitol Hot Dog Day at the Rayburn Courtyard on Capitol Hill in Washington D.C., the United States, on July 23.

A working staff seals off a computer at Shanghai Husi Food Co., Ltd, a meat supplier for McDonald and KFC, in Shanghai, east China, July 20. 

Shanghai food and drug administration has suspended the operation of the food company suspected of supplying stale meat to McDonald and KFC outlets.

Do you know how to quickly cool down your car when it has been exposed under the sun for a long time? 

Leave one side window open and keep shutting the door on the other side for no less than 5 times. It's that easy!
A sedan got flatted by a large truck after a serious collision in Qingdao, east China's Shandong province on July 22. This incident has caused 1 died and 2 injured.
Yugu scenic corridor, located in Sunan Yugu autonomous county in northwest China's Gansu province, covers an area of 880 square kilometers.

Chinese police have detained 10 people responsible for a fatal highway explosion that killed at least 43 on July 21.

The 20 people include those involved in illegal production, sales and transportation of hazardous chemicals and illegal modifying and camouflaging of vehicles, as well as the legal persons and safety management personnel of problematic passenger transportation companies.

A van loaded with alcohol rear-ended a passenger coach Saturday on a section of the Hukun (Shanghai to Kunming) Expressway in central China's Hunan Province. A huge explosion followed and flames engulfed five vehicles, which killed 43 and injured six.

NBA Star LeBron James started visiting China on July 21 at Wukesong Stadium in Beijing, capital of China. 

James perform the piano duet with Chinese pianist Lang Lang.

Chinese President Xi Jinping arrived Caracas on July 20 for a state visit to Venezuela, the third leg of his four-nation Latin America tour.

He was warmly greeted by Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro after the landing of his plane, which was escorted to the airport by two Venezuelan fighter jets after it entered the Venezuelan airspace.

In remarks made upon arrival, Xi said the sincere friendship between China and Venezuela spans the vast oceans between them, and lauded the bilateral strategic partnership for common development.

President of the International AIDS Society (IAS) Francoise Barre-Sinoussi from France (2nd R) and other delegates observe a moment of silence during the opening of the 20th International AIDS Conference at the Melbourne Convention and Exhibition Centre (MCEC) in Melbourne, Australia, on July 20. 

At least six delegates heading for Melbourne to join the 20th international AIDS conference were killed in the crash of Malaysian flight ＃MH17.

Chinese President Xi Jinping (L) shakes hands with Argentine President Cristina Fernandez de Kirchner during a welcoming ceremony before their talks in Buenos Aires, Argentina, July 18. 

Xi and his Argentine counterpart, Cristina Fernandez de Kirchner, agreed here Friday to upgrade bilateral ties to a comprehensive strategic partnership.

Three elementary school students to sell tableware on the streets in Quanzhou, southeast China's Fujian, July 17. Their summer homework's topic is "paying back society." The students said they want to donate the money to charity houses.

Polar bear Tonki enjoys food at the Everland Amusement Park in Yongin, Gyeonggi province, Korea, July 17. 

The polar bear is given special iced treats by zoo keepers during the hot summer.
Members of the Taiwu Children's Ancient Ballads Troupe attend the awarding ceremony of the 25th Golden Melody Awards in Taipei, southeast China's Taiwan, June 28.

As the summer holidays fast approaching, family friendly activities in Shanghai, east China are welcomed by children and parents.

Two South Korean musicals "Yoohoo Takes You Around the World" and "Cats"  are featured at Shanghai Children's Theater currently. 

Photo taken on Thursday, June 26 shows musical performers stay after the play in full costume to meet and greet their young audience.
Chinese President Xi Jinping (L) holds a welcome ceremony for Myanmar President U Thein Sein outside the Great Hall of the People before their talks in Beijing, capital of China, June 27.

Tourists visit the Laxmi Vilas Palace in Vadodara, Gujarat of India, June 26. 

Still the residence of Vadodara's royal family, Laxmi Vilas Palace was built in the 19th century with a blend of Indo-Saracenic culture. As the most impressive Raj-era palace in Gujarat, its elaborate interiors boast well-maintained mosaics, chandeliers and artworks.
Qapqal County, Xinjiang on June 25 sentenced 9 terrorists in a public trial and announced arrested 39 others.

Monks have a Buddhism class at Qamdo Monastery in Jinchuan County, southwest China's Sichuan Province, June 25. 

The Tibetan Buddhism monastery is located at an altitude of 2,000 meters in Sichuan and has been at least 1,000 years old.

Passengers wait at Kobry El-Kobba station in Cairo, Egypt, June 25. 

At least three people were injured Wednesday morning when two home-made bombs went off at two metro stations in the Egyptian capital of Cairo, the Interior Ministry source said. The metro resumed working after more than 15 minutes halt.

Visitors enjoy themselves at the Copacabana beach in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil, June 24. 

According to Brazilian authorities, a total of 400,000 foreign visitors and 450,000 domestic visitors are expected to come to Rio de Janeiro during 2014 FIFA World Cup.

Chinese President Xi Jinping met with Malaysian Speaker of the House of Representatives Pandikar Amin Mulia on Tuesday, saying that China attaches great importance to its friendly relationship with Malaysia.

Xi proposed the two sides take the 40th anniversary of diplomatic relations as an opportunity to do a "top-down design" of the bilateral ties and blueprint reciprocal cooperation in various areas to boost the countries' partnership.

Xi also said China hopes Malaysia will continue to coordinate with relevant countries to search for the missing flight MH370.

Italy coach Cesare Prandelli has resigned following the team's elimination from the World Cup on Tuesday.

The Azzurri, reduced to 10 men after Claudio Marchisio's 59th-minute red card, were sent packing after Diego Godin headed in a late winner at the Arena das Dunas stadium.

It was the second consecutive time that Italy has failed to advance beyond the group stage after winning the tournament for a fourth time in 2006.
Visitors view the lotus flowers in the West Lake scenic area in Hangzhou, capital of east China's Zhejiang Province, June 24.

Fujian's biggest patrol and search-and-rescue vessel "Haixun 0805" is put into service on June 23. 

It's commissioned for long-distance patrolling, safety monitoring, search and rescue, pollution fighting and safeguarding national sovereignty. The vessel will be under the administration of the Fuzhou Maritime Safety Administration.
Photo taken on June 22 shows lavender fields in Yining County under Kazak Autonomous Prefecture of Ili, northwest China's Xinjiang Uygur Autonomous Region.

Visitors pose for group photos in front of a bus during the Bus Cavalcade on Regent Street in London, capital of Britain, on June 22. 

Almost 50 buses from the earliest horse-drawn model of the 1820s right up to the New Routemasters of the present day were on display in downtown London to celebrate the "Year of the Bus" on Sunday.

Visitors look at an vintage racing car at the Collector Car Show in Vancouver, Canada, June 20. 

The second annual Collector Car Show and Auction showcases over 700 vintage vehicles including nearly 150 classic rides for auction.

Some Chinese airlines have banned their pilots from staying up late to watch World Cup soccer matches for safety reasons.

China Southern Airlines, the country's largest carrier in terms of fleet, also forbidden its frontline staff members, which include pilots, from watching or discussing the tournament during work.

China Southern is focusing on preventing the risks of pilot fatigue and drinking problems that may result from watching the games, the notice said.
World War II bullets discovered at Nanjing invasion site on June 20.
Wang Maoshe, party chief of Yuncheng City,Shanxi, was taken away by investigators on  June 19: China Business Journal
An Indian holy man ties a thread on the hand of a devotee at the premises of Kamakhya temple ahead of the annual Ambubasi festival that will start from coming Sunday in Guwahati, India, June 19.

Stewardesses of CRH (China Railway High- speed) trains receive etiquette training in Chongqing, southwest China, June 18. 

As the CRH trains heading from southwest China's Chongqing and Sichuan to eastern China will soon be opened, a total of 169 stewardesses are busy with receiving training.

International Monetary Fund(IMF) Managing Director Christine Lagarde(2nd, R) attends a press conference at the IMF headquarters in Washington D.C., the United States, on June 16. 

The International Monetary Fund on Monday sharply lowered its U.S. economic growth forecasts for this year from the perviously predicted 2.8 percent to 2 percent due to a weak first quarter.

Participants pose for a photo during a running event to mark Batman's 75th anniversary at a park in Taipei, Taiwan on June 14, 2014. The 5-kilometer "night running" event attracted nearly 10,000 participants.
Cast members attend the press conference for the film Girls in Shanghai, east China,June 15. The film Girls, which is directed by Babara Wong, isscheduled to be released on July 31
Kids play ashore as the seashore is occupied by green algae at a beach park in Lianyungang, southeast China's Jiangsu province, June 15. Green algae has struck the beaches of the city since June.

Israeli soldiers patrol in the West Bank City of Hebron early June 15. 

Israel's security forces continued a massive manhunt for three Jewish youths who went missing in the West Bank Thursday night. Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has said that the Jewish youths were kidnapped by a terrorist organization.
Children practice skills of Peking opera at a kindergarten in Liaocheng City, east China's Shandong Province, June 13.
A demonstrator clashes with members of the National Bolivarian Guard in Caracas, Venezuela, on June 12.

Two custom cars are displayed during the International Tokyo Toy Show in Tokyo, capital of Japan, June 12.
