The International Tokyo Toy Show opened here on Thursday. Some 157 attendees from Japan and other countries and regions displayed about 35,000 new toys during the show.

On June 10, with the sound of sutra bugle, lamas and many Buddhists carried on the large-scale Padmasambhava Thangka or Thanka Paintings to the platform for the exhibition of the Buddha.

The grand ceremony not only attracted many local Buddhists, but also many pilgrims from China and abroad. Tsurpu Monastery is the ancestral temple of Karma Kagyu sect of Tibetan Buddhism and has nearly one thousand years of history.

Models show gems and jewelry during an exhibition in Phnom Penh, Cambodia, June 12. 

The sixth edition of gems and jewelry fair kicked off here Thursday with an aim to promote Cambodia's nascent precious stones and jewelry industry.

Brazil beat Croatia 3-1 during the 2014 World Cup opener on Jun 12, in Sao Paolo,Brazil.

Star striker Neymar stroke twice to help five-time champions Brazil rally to beat Croatia 3-1 in the World Cup opener here on Thursday.
Chinese President Xi Jinping (L) holds a welcoming ceremony for Denis Sassou Nguesso, president of the Republic of Congo, before their talks in Beijing, capital of China, June 12, 2014.
What a comfortable summer
Afghan women make traditional handicrafts at a traditional dress-making factory in Bamyan province, Afghanistan, June 10.

68-year-old captain Lee Joon-seok is seen during a trial at the Gwangju District Court in the southwestern South Korean city of Gwangju on June 10. 

The trial opened on Tuesday for the captain and three crew members of the sunken ferry " Sewol" with murder as they abandoned the ship without helping rescue or evacuate hundreds of passengers.

Scottish Deputy First Minister Nicola Sturgeon on Monday outlined how independence can improve the lives of individuals, families and communities throughout Scotland in the first all-women Scottish Cabinet event. 

Scottish Cabinet marked the 100-day countdown to the referendum on Scottish independence.
A Thai boxing professional athlete coaches a journalist to practice defensive tactics in a gym, Beijing, June 8.
Jodhpur, known as the "blue city", is the second largest city in Rajasthan in India.

Security officers stand guard outside Karachi airport following an attack by militants in southern Pakistani port city of Karachi, on June 9. 

At least 23 people were killed and several planes reportedly damaged as a group of heavily armed militants stormed at Jinnah International Airport, southern Pakistan's Karachi on late Sunday night.

Athletes compete during the women's 10,000m final of the Commonwealth Games Kenya Trials at the Nyayo National Stadium in Nairobi, capital of Kenya, June 6. Florence Kiplagat won the title with 32:30.60.
Fireworks is seen during a ceremony marking 70th anniversary of D-Day landings, in Sword beach in Ouistreham, Normandy, northern France on June 6, 2014.

World War II veterans Phil Slack, Joseph Navarra and Ralph Frias attend a ceremony marking the 70th anniversary of the D-Day Normandy landings in World War II, in Washington D.C., the United States, on June 6.

Special operations forces participate in the "Eager Lion" military drill at the Gulf of Aqaba, some 330 kilometers south of Amman, Jordan, June 5. 

The Jordan-hosted "Eager Lion" international military drill with the participation of 22 countries seeks to strengthen the skills of the Jordanian army and enhance cooperation, the army said.

People walk across a flooded street in Shiqian County, southwest China's Guizhou Province, June 5. 

6 people were reported dead and another missing after torrential rains hit the county on Tuesday and Wednesday. Power, water and communications were cut off.

Chinese President Xi Jinping delivers a keynote speech on the relations and cooperation between China and Arab states at the opening ceremony of the Sixth Ministerial Conference of the China-Arab States Cooperation Forum (CASCF) in Beijing, capital of China, June 5, 2014.

Wolf cubs play at Shenyang Wildlife Zoo in Shenyang, capital of northeast China's Liaoning Province, June 5. 

Nine wolf cubs met with visitors in the zoo after artificial feeding for more than 50 days.
Photo taken on June 1 shows the view of Belgium's historic city Gent.

The trial run for the first high-speed railway in Xinjiang Uygur Autonomous Region started on Tuesday, marking a countdown to formal operations by the end of the year and a confidence boost to the region. The speed of the train ranges between 160km to 277km per hour.

Chinese President Xi Jinping said here on Wednesday that China pays great attention to the situation in west Asia and north Africa, during a meeting with visiting Kuwait Prime minister Sheikh Jaber Al-Mubarak Al-Hamad Al-Sabah.

Xi said that China supports Kuwait to play a positive role in regional affairs, and stands ready to work with countries in the region to promote political solutions of regional issues and safeguard local peace and stability.

Jaber conveyed a letter from Emir of Kuwait Sheikh Sabah Al-Ahmed Al-Sabah to Xi, in which the Kuwaiti Emir extended greetings to the Chinese president and spoke highly of their bilateral relationship.

Kuwait attaches importance to the relations, and backs China to protect national sovereignty, security and territorial integrity, as well as to crack down on the "three evil forces" of separatism, extremism and terrorism, Jaber said.

An exhibitor promotes a stereo set at the 2014 COMPUTEX Taipei, one of the largest international information and communications technology (ICT) show, in Taipei, southeast China's Taiwan, June 3. 

This year's COMPUTEX Taipei, opening on Tuesday, attracted more than 1,700 exhibitors, with the estimated visitor number exceeding 130,000.

American actress Angelina Jolie meets the media on the Bund in east China's Shanghai, June 3. 

Angelina Jolie will promote "Maleficent", a fantasy adventure film she starred in, during her Shanghai visit, which is also her first time to the Chinese mainland. "Maleficent" will be debuted in the Chinese mainland on June 20.

Tourists drift by rafts at the Chaotianhou scenery spot in Xingshan County, central China's Hubei Province, June 1, 2014, the second day of the Dragon Boat Festival holiday. 

By drifting down the stream, tourists could enjoy the beautiful landscape in the scenery spot, along with precious coolness in hot summer.

Actresses perform a dance adapted from the folk story "Qiqiao" during the Qiqiao Culture Festival in Xihe County of Longnan City, northwest China's Gansu Province, June 1. 

Girls here have a tradition to pray for good luck from "Qiao Goddess" during the Qiqiao Festival.

Apple Inc. announced an update to its desktop operating system Monday at its 2014 Worldwide Developer's Conference, calling the new OSX 10.10 Yosemite, following a new naming convention of beautiful places in California.

Rival Palestinian factions Islamic Hamas movement and Palestinian President Mahmoud Abbas Fatah Party on Monday ended more than seven years of internal division and formed first ever interim unity technocrats' government.

After resolving disagreements between the two groups on foreign affairs and prisoners' affairs portfolios in the last moment, the 17 ministers, members of the unity government, headed by Prime Minister Rami Hamdallah, were sworn in before Abbas in the city of Ramallah.

A woman leads one of the 23 horses that arrived from Belgium yesterday for the Global Champions Tour of Shanghai show jumping event. 

The contest, which runs from Friday to Sunday, will be staged at an arena close to the site of the former China Pavilion at the 2010 Shanghai World Expo.
Actress Ying Er in vintage look

More than 1,700 pilgrims from 23 associations in Hunan gathered in Nanyue for a pilgrimage, bringing the scene recorded in historical documents to life On May 26, 2014.

According to historical accounts, the pilgrims "held incense, bent their knees on the street every three, five and seven steps. The filial song resounded through the valley." The pilgrimage has become the largest pilgrimage to Nanyue, or the Southern Mountain.

Thai soldiers stand guard around Victory Monument in Bangkok, Thailand, May 29, 2014. 

The priority of Thailand's military- run National Council for Peace and Order (NCPO) is to ensure national administration functions as normal and key policies can be implemented, a foreign ministry spokesman said Thursday.

Turkish soldiers actduring the Efes 2014 military exercise at Izmir's Doganbey Gulfnear the town of Seferihisar, Turkey, on May 29. 

A total of 8,500 Turkish soldiers from the air, naval and land forces tookpart in the exercise.

China's Chengguan(urban management officers) top the worst image among civil officials, followed by school principal, hospital director, village head, police, State-owned enterprise leaders, said a blue book Published by China Academy of Social Sciences on May 26.

A local people rides along terraced fields in Wubu Village of Jingning She Autonomous County, east China's Zhejiang Province, May 27. 

Local people in Wubu Village, which keeps lots of ancient She ethnic customs, are busy farming as terraced fields here enter into plough season.
A model presents civilization theme dresses during the Istanbul Civilizations Fashion Show, in Istanbul, Turkey, on May 28, 2014.

Data shows 1300 Chinese officials faced disciplinary actions since April this year for organizing lavish wedding or funeral banquets, Central Commission for Discipline Inspection CPC announced on May 26.

Among officials be punished, 2 were provincial level and 74 were prefectural level.

The Chinese State Council, the country's cabinet, has issued a guideline to boost healthcare reforms this year.

The guideline, announced in a government statement on Wednesday, puts forward 31 tasks in six fields to deepen the reforms.

700 more counties will start trial reforms of their public hospitals in 2014.Those in public hospitals will be stepped up through adjusting prices of medical services, improving medicine purchasing in county-level hospitals and fine tuning policies and mechanisms for traditional Chinese medicines, the statement said.

Chinese Vice President Li Yuanchao met here Wednesday with  Hiromasa Yonekura, chairman of the Japan Business Federation.

"What is needed to mend China-Japan ties is Japan's right attitudes and proper handling of prominent problems related to history and the Diaoyu Islands," Li said.

Yonekura said that the Japan Business Federation will make contribution to the improvement of the bilateral relations, as it is Japan's biggest economic group.
People visit the Tian'anmen Square with sunshades in Beijing, capital of China, May 28. The city's meteorological department issued this year's first yellow alert for heat Tuesday.

A training class to help trainees sleep better opens in Changsha of central China's Hunan province on May 26. 

The trainees are all white-collar workers and the training could help them release pressure and achieve deep sleep through taking exercises, listening to music and relaxing.

The Chinese and Russian navies on Saturday concluded the three-day real combat drill named "Joint Sea-2014" on the East China Sea, and all warships participating in the drill returned to a Shanghai port Sunday. Russian warships leaved Shanghai for home on Tuesday, May 27.

Brittany and her son Christian mourn for her husband who was killed in Afghanistan in 2011 at the section 60 of Arlington National Cemetery, outside Washington D.C., the United States, May 26. 

People crowded in Arlington National Cemetery, especially in Section 60, where America's most recent war dead lie, during the memorial day. (Yin Bogu)

A visit to the "hometown of terrorists" in Xinjiang 

The Xinjiang attack killed 43 on May 22 has been cracked down. The 4 terrorists died in the blast were all from Pishan County, Hotan Prefecture, Xinjiang. 

Global Times reporter visited Pishan County, a place known by some as the hometown of terrorists. 

A majority of middle school students there don't know how to write their names in Chinese; farmers are so poor that they can't even afford to buy corns and all they have are the four bare walls at home. 

It's certainly not coincidence that Xinjiang has many terrorists. Grassroots bear the pain resulted from issues such as poverty, narrow-minded, and corruption in local officials. All these problems have created a vicious cycle.(Joanna)

Beijing police have deployed helicopters for daily air patrols of the city as a new measure to tighten security, the Beijing Municipal Public Security Bureau announced on Monday.

Since Saturday, five police helicopters have patrolled eight routes covering transport hubs, shopping centers and scenic spots two or three times every day. They will also patrol major highways and crowded areas.

Mathieu Beugnet, Romain Beugnet, Adrien Bart and Stephane Hascoet of France paddle in C4 men 1000m final at the 2014 ICF Canoe Sprint and Paracanoe World Cup in Szeged, Hungary, on May 24, 2014. They won gold with a time of 3 minutes and 33.256 seconds.

Soldiers dismantle damaged houses in earthquake-hit Kachang Township of Yingjiang County, southwest China's Yunnan Province, May 24. 

The earthquake, which happened at 4:49 a.m. in Yingjiang County on May 24, had affected 313,000 residents and damaged 9,688 houses as of 7:40 p.m. on May 24. 

About 3,000 rescuers are working to remove potential risks, set up tents and resume the power supply. (Hao Yaxin)

An Argentinian student shows her Chinese calligraphy during the "Chinese Bridge" Competition, May 23. 

The Argentine preliminary of the 13th "Chinese Bridge" -- Chinese Proficiency Competition for Foreign University Students was held in Buenos Aires on Friday.

Subway passengers in Beijing will have to face security check at three more stations starting Saturday as a new measure was launched to beef up subway security.

In January, Beijing Subway required that passengers should go through security check at six stations, all near the Tian'anmen Square in central Beijing.

The security measure was expanded to three more stations -- two in the city's north and one in the west -- on Saturday, all far from the downtown area, according to the Beijing Subway.

A visitor captured funny moments at Haus des Meeres Aqua Terra Zoo in Vienna of Austria:  one snapping turtle came to a sudden halt, but two behind failed to notice the their path was blocked. Within minutes seven turtles were waiting patiently in line for the first one to get himself moving again

Students walk in a flooded tunnel in Nonghuai Village of Bao'an Township, Yao Autonomous County of Du'an, south China's Guangxi Zhuang Autonomous Region, May 23. 

The tunnel leading to township was flooded by rainstorms with water of 60 to 70 centimeters deep in some places.
Lamborghini cars are shown at the Lamborghini Gallery in Hong Kong, south China, May 23.

Police have identified 5 suspects who took part in a terrorist attack in Urumqi, west China on Thursday that killed 39 innocent people and injured another 94.

4 of the suspects died in the bomb attack. Another one was caught by police on Thursday night in Bayingolin Mongolia Autonomous Prefecture.

The suspects had long been influenced by the religious extremism. They took part in illegal religious activities, watched and listened to terrorist violence video and audio materials, according to the police.
Models present creations by Indonesian designer Deden Siswanto during Jakarta Fashion and Food Festival at Kelapa Gading in Jakarta, Indonesia, May 22, 2014.
United Nations Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon (2nd R) visits the "Zhou Bin Academy" at China Energy Fund Committee in Shanghai, May 22.

Picture taken on May 21, 2014 shows that two residents try to avoid a pond of water with their bikes in the city of Sabac, some 90 kilometres west of Belgrade, Serbia. 

Serbia prepared defences against an increasing level of the Sava River due to the heavy rains that struck Balkans. Serbia is under state of emergency since May 15.

Villagers drives a rice planter as they transplant rice seedlings in Yufeng Village of Zhaoxing Township in Luobei County, northeast China's Heilongjiang Province, May 19. 

Farmers in Luobei, Suibin and Tongjiang counties, which suffered from serious flood in 2013, are busy with spring ploughing.

#Xinjiangblast: The explosion happened in an open air morning market, which is located near the Renmin Park in downtown Urumqi. Ambulance and police cars are parking at the entrance of Park North Street leading to the market.

Police have evacuated the scene and all wounded have been sent to hospitals. Traffic nearby the scene has returned to normal. Official number of casualties still unknown.

Visitors view lilies in rain in Wanzai County, east China's Jiangxi Province, May 21. 

Wanzai County, with a history of planting lilies for about 500 years, has around 5,000 mu (about 333.3 hectares) of lilies to attract visitors this year.

A farmer repairs the waterwheel in Zhongling Township of Jinping County, southwest China's Guizhou Province, May 21. 

As Xiaoman (grain full), the 8th solar term in Chinese lunar calendar, comes on Wednesday, farmers here are busy with summer planting.
Porntip Buranaprasertsuk of Thailand returns a shot to P.V. Sindhu of India during the Uber Cup Group Y match at Siri Fort Stadium in New Delhi, India, May 20. P.V. Sindhu won 2-0 in this game.

39 people in Xinjiang Uygur Autonomous Region, west China, have been sentenced since March 31 for spreading videos that incited violence, organizing and taking part in terrorist activities, advocating ethnic hatred and illegally manufacturing firearms.

In the latest cases, three people were killed and 79 injured in an attack on April 30 at a railway station in Urumqi, Xinjiang's capital. Earlier in March, assailants killed 29 civilians and injured another 143 at a railway station in the southwestern city of Kunming.

Vessels sail to the five-level ship lock of the Three Gorges in Yichang, central China's Hubei Province, May 19. 

The Three Gorges have lowered its water level to meet with the upcoming flood season, which allows vessels to shorten travel time by 40 minutes as they pass the five-level ship lock of the Three Gorges

Russian President Vladimir Putin (front) arrives in Shanghai, east China, May 20, 2014. Putin arrived in Shanghai early Tuesday to start his state visit to China and attend the fourth Summit of the Conference on Interaction and Confidence Building Measures in Asia.
China's Xie Wenjun celebrates after winning the men's 110m hurdles race at the IAAF Diamond League Athletics in Shanghai, east China, May 18, 2014.

A boy has a paint of an Egyptian flag on his cheek during a campaign for the presidential candidate Abdel-Fattah el-Sissi in Cairo, Egypt, May 18, 2014. 

Egyptians gathered here on Sunday to back Sisi's running for president over the upcoming presidential election on May 26th and 27th.

Two hundred couples who are alumni of Zhejiang University attend a group wedding at the university in Hangzhou, capital of east China's Zhejiang Province, May 17, 2014. The wedding was one of the activities celebrating the 117 anniversary of the university.
People hold a flag during a rally marking the International Day Against Homophobia and Transphobia, in Caracas, Venezuela, on May 17, 2014.

A student performs during the preliminary contest of Ghana section of The 13th "Chinese Bridge" Proficiency Competition on May 17 in Accra, Ghana. 

The 13th "Chinese Bridge" Proficiency Competition for students of Chinese language and culture was held here Saturday at the University of Ghana in association with the local Confucius Institute. The "Chinese Bridge" Competition is an annual event organized by the Hanban and the Confucius Institute of China since 2002, which aims to encourage foreign students to learn Chinese.

Dancers perform as they take part in the annual dance parade in New York City, the United States, on May 17. 

Thousands of dancers came to Manhattan of New York City during the dance parade to perform over 70 types of dances that can be found around the world. (Wang Lei)

A Hainan Airlines aircraft from Taiyuan to Xiamen collided with a bird in high altitude on May 16.

The flight landed safely at Hefei Airport. The incident caused no casualties.

A Chinese cuisine cooked by Chinese chef is seen in Copenhagen, Denmark, on May 16, 2014. A team led by Wang Yong, a chef from Hangzhou of China, cooked exquisite Chinese cuisine and snack for the local residents at Nimb Brasserie on Friday.

A visitor takes photo of a painting by Chinese oil painter Cao Xinlin during his exhibition "Bond to the Beloved Land" in Beijing, May 16. Over 180 pieces of paintings Cao created during his nearly 60 years of art career were on display.

The world's largest blue diamond comes with a price tag to match. The sparkling 13.22 carat gem known as "the Blue" sold at a Christie's auction in Geneva on Wed for  23.8 million U.S. dollars.

The pear-shaped stone described as the world's largest flawless vivid blue diamond had been expected to fetch between 21 to 25 million dollars.

A farmer of the Menba ethnic group works at a banana plantation in Medog County, southwest China's Tibet Autonomous Region, May 10. 

Medog, the last county in China to gain road access to the outside world, has about 153 hectares of banana trees and plans to expand the acreage to over 670 hectares in the future.
Syrian children around a food cart wait for the owner's alms at a camp in northern Lebanon's Akkar, May 15.

Over 300 students perform Kongfu with fans at Chongde Primary School in Chongfu Town of Tongxiang City, east China's Zhejiang Province, May 16. 

The school has promoted the traditional Chinese martial arts like Taichi and Kongfu fan as exercises for students since 2003.

A technician examines the bullet train CRH 380A in Nanchang, capital of east China's Jiangxi Province, May 15. 

The Hangzhou-Nanchang-Changsha High Speed Railway will open to traffic this September. Two CRH 380A will be put into service on this route.

A miner was rescuedout of the mine in Manisa on May 14, 2014.  The death toll of Turkey's coal mine disaster Tuesday has reached 282, making it the country' s worst industrial disaster in history, Energy Minister Taner Yildiz said early Thursday.

A supporter of the former Honduran President Manuel Zelaya participates in a clash against police in front of the National Congress in Tegucigalpa, Honduras, on May 13. 

Followers and deputies of the Liberty and Refoundation Party, the second political force in Honduras, broke in the National Congress on Tuesday, after clashing with police elements that guarded the Legislative Palace.

Lakhdar Brahimi (R), UN-Arab League special envoy to Syria, looks on as UN Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon speaks during a press briefing at the UN headquarters in New York, on May 13. 

UN Secretary-General Ban Ki- moon on Tuesday announced that he accepted the request of Lakhdar Brahimi to step down as the UN-Arab League special envoy to Syria, adding that the resignation will be effective on May 31.

Buddhism was introduced to Chaoyang city, northeast China's Liaoning province in East Jin Dynasty (317-420). In the following 700 years until Liao Dynasty (907-1125), Buddhism enjoyed a great popularity in the area and Chaoyang became the center of Buddhist culture in northeast China. 

Now, the ancient Buddhist towers and temples in Chaoyang are the best witnesses to history.

People from the US and China gather at the Central Pacific Railroad to honor the Chinese workers who built the railroad 145 years ago. Many of them risked their lives and died from the harsh winters and dangerous conditions.

Between 1865 and 1869, about 12,000 Chinese Americans and Chinese immigrants were hired to construct the western section of the transcontinental railroad. They accounted for 85 percent of the labor force on the Central Pacific--the largest workforce in the US at the time.

Firemen in Dongguan City, Guangdong Province used inflatable boat to transfer people trapped in heavy rain pouring in Pearl River Delta on May 12.

Heavy rains and floods have battered Guangdong, Hunan and Jiangxi provinces since Thursday, destroying 1,400 houses, forcing the evacuation of more than 50,000 residents and inundating 15,000 hectares of cropland.

Players of Manchester City celebrate after clinching the title at the end of the Barclays Premier League match between Manchester City and West Ham United at Etihad Stadium in Manchester, Britain on May 11, 2014. Manchester City claimed their second Premier League title in three seasons after beating West Ham United with 2-0.

A contestant of Miss Tourism International China Final poses for photos during the parade in Wuhan, central China's Hubei Province.
The fair will kick off here on May 12. (Cheng Min)

A car is seen damaged in a blast in Sanaa, Yemen, on May 9. A bomb blast targeted a military vehicle carrying Yemeni soldiers to checkpoints near the U.S. and British embassies in Sanaa on Thursday, one day after the U.S. embassy was closed for fears of terrorist attacks. Three Yemeni soldiers were wounded in the blast.

People remove debris from a destroyed house in earthquake hit area of southern Pakistan's Nawabshah, May 9, 2014. At least two people were killed and 40 others injured when a 5.0-magnitude earthquake hit Pakistan's southern Nawabshah district on Friday.
A model presents a creation by Spanish brand Yolan Cris at the Barcelona Bridal Week in Barcelona, May 7, 2014. The Barcelona Bridal Week runs from May 6 to 11.

Wang Jiarui (C), vice chairman of the National Committee of the Chinese People's Political Consultative Conference and head of the International Department of the Communist Party of China (CPC) Central Committee, meets with former U.S. Secretary of State Henry Kissinger (L) in New York, the United States, May 6, 2014.

Chinese policemen were expected to help patrol tourist destinations in Paris this summer amid a rise in attacks and robberies targeting Chinese visitors, French sources said Tuesday.

The French police will invite 10 Chinese counterparts to patrol with them to better serve the Chinese tourists. In addition to patrolling, the Chinese policemen would also serve as interpreters when Chinese tourists need to communicate with local police.

Chinese President Xi Jinping & Taiwan's People First Party chairman James Soong met in Beijing on Wednesday.

Xi Jinping said that economic integration will bring about win-win results for Chinese mainland & Taiwan.

China's e-commerce giant Alibaba has filed initial public offering (IPO) document to the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) with plans to raise one billion U.S. dollars, according to SEC information and well-informed sources. Analysts said the one billion U.S. dollar is only an initial figures and that the actual amount could be much bigger.

Members of a special Jordanian police unit show their skills in an anti-terrorism operation during the Special Operations Forces Exhibition & Conference (SOFEX) trade show on May 6, 2014 at King Abdullah I Airbase in the Jordanian capital, Amman. The exhibition started in Jordan on Tuesday with the participation of a wide array of exhibitors in the defense industry.
Huge billboards showing welcoming message to visiting Chinese Premier Li Keqiang are seen in Addis Ababa, Ethiopia

Nine aerial performers were injured when a platform fell Sunday afternoon during a circus show in Providence, Rhode Island, U.S.

The incident happened during the hire wire act when it snapped, leaving six critically injured and three others with non-life-threatening injuries.

All the victims are expected to survive and are at Rhode Island Hospital.

A man uses scissors to cut a strand of hair from his bride as a symbol of eternal love at a group wedding staged in traditional style. Fifty-two young couples attended the event in Youyang, Chongqing municipality, on Friday.

The death toll from the collapse of an uncompleted bridge in Gaozhou City, south China's Guangdong Province has risen to 11 as of Sunday morning, said local authorities.

Rescuers pulled 27 people out of the debris, including 5 dead on the spot and 8 others sustaining serious injuries, 6 of them later died in the hospital.

People watch the rescue operations in Aab Bareek, Badakhshan, Afghanistan, May 3. 

A massive landslide hit a village in northern Afghan Badakhshan province on Friday, causing heavy casualties, but the exact number of deaths and injuries remained unknown Saturday as officials here released contradictory numbers.
#AirlinesMH370: Malaysian government on Thursday released the flight path map of the missing jet.

Chinese President Xi Jinping has ordered troops stationed in Xinjiang to deal a "crushing blow" to terrorists.

Speaking with senior PLA officials on Sunday when visiting the People's Liberation Army (PLA) troops stationed in Xinjiang, Xi ordered PLA forces to assist local government and party departments in combating terrorism and safeguarding social stability.

All forms of terrorism should be rooted out in an early phase, while decisive action must be taken to stop terrorists gaining momentum, he said.
German Chancellor Angela Merkel (R) shakes hands with visiting Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe during the welcoming ceremony at the Chancellery in Berlin, capital of Germany, on April 30.
A merchant cleans the chicken house at a market in Shanghai, east China, April 30, 2014. Shanghai will resume the live poultry trade starting from May 1.

Greek actress Katerina Lehou, playing the role of high priestess, lights the torch with the Olympic Flame during a handover ceremony at Panathenaean Stadium in Athens, Greece, April 30, 2014. 

The flame for the Nanjing Youth Olympics was lit in Athens on Wednesday to mark the symbolic start of the torch relay ahead of the games.

link_name: Early People's Liberation Army posters, signatures of an era

status_message:
Chinese Premier Li Keqiang met with former U.S. Treasury Secretary Timothy Geithner in Beijing on Tuesday for closer economic ties.

Li briefed the U.S. guests on the relationship between China's reform and economic growth, noting that tremendous economic development resulted from reform.

China is a developing country and enjoys great potential for economic growth but faces challenges including uneven development between urban and rural areas, lack of natural resources and environmental pollution, Li said.
Vehicles run in dust in Xining, capital of northwest China's Qinghai Province, April 29, 2014. The capital city was shrouded by floating dust on Tuesday.

A group of concerned workers and members of the National Domestic Workers Alliance, National Peoples Action and the Restaurant Opportunities Center United stage a protest against income inequality and the growing chasm between rich and poor Americans in front of the Capitol in Washington D.C., capital of the United States, April 28, 2014.

Security force members check the site of a suicide explosion in Kirkuk, Iraq, April 28. 

Over ten security members were killed and some 50 others wounded in attacks targeting polling centers in Iraq for early parliamentary elections on Monday, police said.

Microsoft founder Bill Gates on Monday took to the pages of the People's Daily, a reading especially for Party officials in China, to encourage people in China to do more for the poor.

"China has many successful entrepreneurs and business people. I hope that more people of insight will put their talents to work to improve the lives of poor people in China and around the world, and seek solutions for them," Gates wrote in an editorial.

"Investing for the poor requires participation from the entire community."

Chinese Premier Li Keqiang on Monday discussed building an economic belt along the Yangtze River to underpin China's sustainable economic development.

Li said that it has been a key pattern in the world's economic development to start in coastal areas and then move inland along rivers to the landlocked regions, and the common experience of many developed countries in their modernization.

Children stand as they wait for their turn during an audition for the School of American Ballet in New York April 25, 2014. The school is holding auditions for over 600 beginner ballet students, who will be selected to fill the 120 spots available to study on campus.

A woman paints cartoon elements on her car during an automobile parade held in Hangzhou, capital of east China's Zhejiang province, April 27. 

Some 100 cars with colorful cartoon drawings took part in the parade in Hangzhou on Sunday as a warming-up activity for the upcoming 10th China International Cartoon and Animation Festival.

Photo taken on April 26, 2014 shows the giant rubber duck in the Phu My Hung residential area in Ho Chi Minh (HCM) City, Vietnam. A 18-meter-tall rubber duck, which has captivated people across the world, will be displayed at the Crescent Lake in the Phu My Hung residential area of HCM city from April 27 to May 31. 

Designed by Dutch artist Florentijn Hofman, the rubber duck started a tour named "Spreading Joys around the World" in 2007. HCM City will be the 16th venue where it is displayed.

A China-made air carrier, a 58-seater Modern Ark 60 (MA60), lands on Tribhuvan International Airport in Kathmandu, Nepal, April 27, 2014. 

The long wait of Nepal government to receive the first China-made air carrier has been over Sunday afternoon with the landing of MA60 at Tribhuvan International Airport.
Azalea blossoms are seen on the Gaogang mountain, southeast China's Fujian Province, April 26. (Zhang Guojun)

After giant panda Meixi was sent back to Sichuan Province last month, Sijia has become the only panda left behind in Kunming, capital of southwest China's Yunnan Province. 

Sijia behaved abnormally last week and showed signs of depression. Workers at the park installed many play facilities, including TV, swing, and single parallel bars, to cheer it up. Now, Sijia is happy again.

A troop unit under the Nanjing Military Area Command (MAC) of the Chinese People's Liberation Army (PLA) organized its armored vehicles to conduct loading and sailing training in strange waters, in a bid to improve troops' comprehensive combat capability.

Catha edulis, also known as khat, is a kind of plant native to Africa containing a stimulant. It has been imported by drug dealers and traded at underground drug markets in China.

Featuring long-lasting euphoric effects similar to heroin, fresh leaves of the plant can be chewed or dried and made into drinks.

Catha edulis, was listed as an illegal drug by Chinese police in 2014.

An international investigation team had been approved to be formed by Malaysian cabinet on Wednesday to investigate the missing #AirelinesMH370 flight incident, Malaysian acting Transport Minister Hishammuddin Hussein said Wednesday.

A two-month-old white lion plays with a puppy at a wildlife park in Hangzhou, capital of east China's Zhejiang Province, April 21, 2014. 

The white lion cub was born in Hangzhou in February. As its mother refused to feed the cub, a dog was brought here by staff members as its wet nurse.
When this cute baby accidentally popped up in others' photo, she seemed the most surprising one: Wait, where am I?

The photo taken on April 14 shows Sun Liang, who was the fattest person in China, several days before he died of cardiac failure in Rizhao city, Shandong province on April 20. Sun, 22, weighed 300 kg, and doctors said the excessive weight put pressure on his organs – especially his heart – and this led to his death.

Students from the Indonesian Naval Academy visit the People's Liberation Army (PLA) Navy Submarine Academy in Qingdao, east China's Shandong Province, April 21. 

Over 90 students arrived in Qingdao on Sunday by an Indonesian naval ship. The ship will take part in a multi-national marine exercise here marking the 65th anniversary of the founding of the Chinese PLA Navy.
Soldiers from the Honourable Artillery Company fire a 62 round royal gun salute to celebrate the 88th birthday of Britain's Queen Elizabeth II at the Tower of London in central London on Monday.
As is shown in this picture, a Scottish man Ian Maclean is receiving special python treatment for curving old wounds on his arm.

Photographer Sergey Anashkevych captures the incredible images of salt flats in Crimea. Lake Sivash is also known as the "Rotten Sea", it's unique dazzling red colours caused by rapid propagation of Dunaliella algae in an abandoned mine.
A group of "Spider men" stage a flash mob at a cinema in Jiangbei district of Nanjing city, east China's Jiangsu province on April 20, 2014.

A new variety of tulip that was named by Peng Liyuan, the wife of President Xi Jinping, during their recent visit to the Netherlands, goes on display for the first time in Beijing on April 20, as part of the Beijing Tulip Culture Festival. Peng named the tulip "Cathay" while on a visit to the world-famous Keukenhof flower garden, and many cities have since been seeking to import the bulbs to China.

A grey heron takes off from a wetland in the Shahu Scenic Area in Yinchuan, capital of northwest China's Ningxia Hui Autonomous Region, April 16, 2014. 

In April, the 80 square kilometers of wetlands in the Shahu Scenic Area in suburban Yinchuan has become home to more than 1.2 million migrating birds.

This combo of photos shows visitors posing for a selfie next to Doraemon figures at an exhibition of "100 Doraemon Secret Gadgets Expo" in Beijing, capital of China, April 19, 2014. 

The exhibition kicked off here on Saturday. A hundred life-size Doraemon figures, each of which bearing a distinct secret gadget, were displayed during the show. Doraemon, a 22nd-century robotic cat, has been a popular anime character since its introduction by Japanese cartoonist Fujiko Fujio in 1969.

A police officer looks at rows of illegal guns in Shanghai yesterday shortly before they were destroyed. 

The firearms were part of a haul of 258 guns, 905 replicas, 902 knives and more than 190,000 bullets seized by police this year. Anyone who provides information to police about people who own, trade or transport illegal weapons could get a reward of up to 50,000 yuan (US$8,000).

#AirlinesMH370: A Thai satellite has detected floating objects that span an area of 450 square kilometers in the Indian Ocean, about 2,700 kilometers from Perth, Australia, a Thai space research agency said Thursday in an on-line statement.

The floating objects are suspected to be related to the missing Malaysia Airlines flight MH370. There are around 300 objects, some longer than two meters, which are scattered about 200 kilometers from the international search area for the missing Malaysian jet.
UNESCO 27th awarded Chinese first lady Peng Liyuan honorary title of Special Envoy to Promote Education for Girls & Women.
Chinese President Xi Jinping (2nd R, front) visits the former site of the Lyon Sino-French Institute in Lyon, France, March 26, 2014.

Candidates attend the interview for air steward held by the Hainan Airlines in Taiyuan, capital of north China's Shanxi Province on March 24. Candidates are required to have good looking as well as good physical conditions so that they can safeguard planes.

Photo shows villager producing tea-seed oil using traditional hand-pressed tea-seed oil mill in southeast China's Fujian province. 

Before the tea seeds go into the semi-automatic oil press machine, they need to be shaped into cakes with a diameter of 33 centimeters and thickness of 5 centimeters by hand.

Christie's official website announced on Wednesday the purchase of the "Min" Fanglei, a massive bronze ritual wine vessel dating back to the late Shang (C.1600-1046BC) and early Western Zhou Dynasties (1046-771BC), by a group of private collectors from China's Hunan Province after a close consultation with the owner of the vessel a day before it would have been auctioned.

Chinese Vice Premier Wang Yang has called for more efforts in developing agriculture to ensure food security and enrich farmers, according to an official statement issued on Tuesday.

China should step up work to increase agricultural production, said Wang at a recent national farming conference. The vice premier emphasized promotion of agricultural technology and development of environmentally friendly agriculture.

He called for increases in the output of low and medium-yielding farmland, improved rural infrastructure, and the development of more quality farmland.
Chinese President Xi Jinping attends the third Nuclear Security Summit (NSS) in The Hague, the Netherlands, March 24, 2014.
Candidates attend the interview for air hostess of the Hainan Airlines in Taiyuan, capital of northwestern China's Shanxi Province on March 23. More than thousand pretty girls joined the recruitment.
#AirlinesMH370: This graphic shows the suspected flight path of MH370 and the location of the past week's debris searches
Pakistani Air Force K-8 Karakorum aircrafts fly in formation during a ceremony to mark Pakistan's National Day in Islamabad, capital of Pakistan, on March 23, 2014.

Artists take part during the launching of the street theater in the framework of the 14th Ibero-American Theater Festival of Bogota (FITB, for its acronym in Spanish), in the city of Bogota, Colombia, on March 19, 2014. More than 1,200 artists from 25 countries will participate in the event performing their plays in parks, streets and avenues of the city, from April 4th to the 20th, according to the local press.

Chinese President Xi Jinping met with Dutch King Willem-Alexander in Amsterdam on Saturday, vowing to further develop ties between the two countries.

Xi arrived here early Saturday for a state visit to the Netherlands, the first one ever made by a Chinese president to the western European country since the establishment of diplomatic ties between the two nations.
Visitors watch peach blossom during the 25th Canal Peach Blossom Festival in Tianjin, north China, March 21, 2014. People in north China started embracing the spring.
Palestinian protestors throw stones at Israeli soldiers during a protest against the expanding of Jewish settlements in Kufr Qadoom village near the West Bank city of Nablus on March. 21, 2014.
Swan lake

A fund has been set up on Thursday to help a baby born at the scene of a car crash where the child's parents died in Xiamen, southeast China's Fujian province.

The baby was born when a truck collided with a motorcycle carrying his parents on Tuesday. The impact killed his parents at the scene and knocked the baby out of his mother's body.
China's Guizhou Province to produce "canned air" products as tourist souvenirs before June 20, with the air coming from Mount Fanjing.

A helicopter regiment of the airborne force under the Air Force of the Chinese People's Liberation Army (PLAAF) organized its helicopters to carry out cross-day-and-night flight training, in a bid to test pilots' flexible operation capability and psychological quality.
#AirlinesMH370: China deployed 3 Air Force aircraft to join SAR in Indian Ocean. They left Sanya at 8am on March 21.

China's icebreaker for Antarctic research, Xuelong, or Snow Dragon, now anchored in Perth, Australia, is "fully prepared" to search for the missing #AirlinesMH370 in an area where possible debris was spotted, maritime authorities said Thursday.
A Norwegian cargo ship reached the isolated ocean zone west of Australia where two floating objects - possibly debris from the #AirlinesMH370 were spotted, the ship's owner said Thursday.

The 11th Shijiazhuang Stone Fair kicked off in Shijiazhuang, capital of north China's Hebei Province, March 18, 2014. Over 500 stone merchants from 20 provinces and cities attended the fair. Thousand types of stones including ornamental stones, ores, and stone handicrafts were exhibited, attracting many people's attention.

A scientist tests a device that could collect electric current during a demonstration on triboelectric generation at the Beijing Institute of Nano-energy and Nano-systems under Chinese Academy of Sciences, Beijing, China, March 18, 2014. This technology could convert random mechanical energy from our environment into electric energy.

Fire fighters try to extinguish a fire raging through the forest at a village in Xichang, southwest China's Sichuan Province, March 18, 2014. Firefighters, forest police officers and armed police and a helicopter have been dispatched to battle the blaze, according to the emergency office.

A FC-1/JF-17 fighter, which is the result of a joint China-Pakistan development programme, is seen during the Dubai Airshow in Dubai, United Arab Emirates, Nov. 17, 2013.

China has become the world's fourth biggest supplier in major weapons over the past five years, notably replacing France, according to a Swedish research institute.

Residents of the Maldives island of Kuda Huvadhoo in Dhaal Atoll have reported seeing a "low flying jumbo jet" on the morning of the disappearance of #AirlinesMH370,reported Haveeru Online. 

People on the island said that it was a white aircraft, with red stripes across it – which is what the Malaysia Airlines flights typically look like.

Eyewitnesses from the Kuda Huvadhoo concurred that the aeroplane was travelling North to South-East, towards the Southern tip of the Maldives – Addu. They also noted the incredibly loud noise that the flight made when it flew over the island.

Indian devotees celebrate the Holi festival, also known as festival of colors, at a temple in Calcutta, capital of eastern Indian state West Bengal, March, 17, 2014. The Holi festival is a popular Hindu spring festival observed in India at the end of winter season on the last full moon day of the lunar month.

"Big brother, it's been over a week now. Let's give them a call."
"Just wait a bit longer"
A Qingdao cartoonist drew this pic to express good wishes to #AirlinesMH370
He Chong of China competes during the men's 3m springboard final at the 2014 FINA Diving World Series in Beijing, capital of China, March 15, 2014. He Chong won the gold medal with 528.80 points.

Marines participate in an actual-troop confrontation training with a brigade under the Beijing Military Area Command at a training base in north China's Inner Mongolia Autonomous Region, March 14, 2014. (Zha Chunming)

Oscars pizza delivery guy gets $1,000 tip

Pizza delivery guy Edgar Martirosyan had a good Sunday night. He got to deliver pizza to the Oscars and received a 1,000 dollar tip.

Edgar, the pizza owner, got the call to deliver pizza to Hollywood's Dolby Theatre for some writers during Sunday night's Academy Awards. He was shocked when host DeGeneres led him to the stage in front of Hollywood actors and 43 million viewers at home.

Best Supporting Actor Jared Leto, Brad Pitt, Meryl Streep and the Jennifer Lawrence all indulged on a piece of the pie, but none of the multi-millionaire nominees in the audience seemed to have any cash on them for a well-deserved tip.

Luckily, when Edgar was invited back onstage for an interview on The Ellen Show Monday, Ellen DeGeneres surprised Edgar with a 1,000 dollar tip for delivering pizza to the Oscars.

China and Pakistan signed agreements

China and Pakistan signed agreements for energy and infrastructure projects on Wednesday as they vowed to soon give "practical shape" to a trade and transport corridor linking the neighbors.

The documents were signed after a meeting between President Xi Jinping and visiting Pakistani President Mamnoon Hussain.

Among the papers signed are memorandums of understanding on construction on the new Gwadar international airport, upgrading part of the Karakorum highway linking the nations and establishing a joint research center for hydropower technology.

The Wall Street Journal assessed the value of the agreements at $20 billion. In the joint statement, China assured Pakistan of "its full support" in helping the latter address its energy deficit.

The world's best corvettes(1)

Naval-technology.com lists the world's top 10 corvettes.

No.1 is the Visby-class advanced stealth corvettes, built by Kockums at the Karlskrona Shipyard, for the Royal Swedish Navy. 

The class includes five versatile vessels designed for anti-surface warfare, anti-submarine warfare (ASW), mine countermeasures and maritime patrol.

Each vessel is armed with a Bofors 57mm Mk 3 general purpose gun, eight Saab RBS15 surface-to-surface missiles, four Saab 40cm ASW torpedoes, ASW rockets and mine rails.

The propulsion system ensures a maximum speed of over 35kt and a range of 2,500nmi at 15kt.

Whaling in the Faroe Islands in the North Atlantic has been practiced since about the time of the first Norse settlements on the islands. Around 950 Long-finned Pilot Whales are killed annually. The hunts are non-commercial and are organized on a community level; anyone can participate.

Many Faroese consider the hunt an important part of their culture and history. Animal-rights groups criticize the hunt as being cruel and unnecessary.

Known as "La Isla de la Munecas", by the Spanish, The Island of the Dolls, which located to the south of Mexico City, is perhaps one of the creepiest tourist attractions in the world.

With old, mutilated dolls decorating nearly every tree on the island, this island "refresh" your understanding of horror. The story behind the Island of the Dolls began when a hermit by the name of Don Julian Santana moved here. 

Don Julian used to say he was haunted by the ghost of the little girl who had drowned in one of the canals around the island. He then began to collect dolls and placed them around his home as a shrine for the spirit that tormented him. At one point he even traded home grown fruit and vegetables for old dolls.

A powerful blast from a pipeline leak has rocked an industrial area on the outskirts of Qingdao city in East China. The blast killed at least 35 people and injured 166 others.

Among the wounded, 65 are in serious condition, but have all been sent to local hospitals to receive treatment. The explosion happened near a massive refinery plant in the city's Huangdao district late Friday morning. The blast sent thick black smoke billowing into the sky and could be seen for kilometers.

Local authorities said that around 3am, an oil pipeline ruptured causing a leak. Initial investigation results suggest the repair process led to a fire, which eventually caused the explosion at around 10am. The 176-kilometer-long pipeline is owned by Sinopec, China's largest oil refiner, and was put into operation this August.

President Xi Jinping has instructed authorities in Shandong province to do everything possible to search for and rescue the missing and injured. He also asked relevant parties to learn from the accident and strengthen production safety measures.

Beijing Symphony Orchestra first appearance in NYC

Beijing Symphony Orchestra has embarked its world tour in October this year, giving performances in Mexico and the US. On October 17, the orchestra made its first appearance in Carnegie Hall, New York. 

Led by Tan Linhua, President and Principal Conductor of the Orchestra, the group aimed to share with the audience works of Western classical and Chinese contemporary symphonic music. The evening began with Lotus Overture and the Chinese flute concerto, Chou Kong Shan (Sorrowful Desolate Mountain) by a Chinese composer called Guo Wenjing. 

The orchestra particularly amazed audience with the second piece, in which Bamboo Flute soloist Tang Jun Qiao played the instrument brilliantly, a showcase of Chinese instruments to Westerners. 

Having given many performances in Europe, Mr. Tan saw the similarity between the audience in two continents, he told People's Daily Online. "I have been touring in Europe a lot; I think the reaction of the audience here is similar. They are picky, because they have a lot of good experiences with wonderful orchestras here," he said. 

Mr. Tan observed that in comparison to the Mexican audience whom they had met in their tour, Chinese audience tends to be relatively conservative, while the former group showed great enthusiasm. 

Overall, Mr. Tan said he's very satisfied with the success the orchestra had of the night in New York. The orchestra ended the concert with a total of five encores, with one of them as the famous Chinese music Jasmine.

The River Safari held a party celebrating the birthday of Kai Kai (turns six years old on Sept. 14) and Jia Jia (turns five years old on Sept. 3), as well as for the first anniversary of their arrival in Singapore.
A dancer from the Philippines performs at the 10th China-ASEAN Expo in Nanning, capital of southwest China's Guangxi Zhuang Autonomous Region.

A woman takes a photo of piglets at the Agriculture & Food Expo 2013 held in Harbin, Northeast China's Heilongjiang Province. China's agricultural products trade reached $103.95 billion in the first seven months of this year, up 4.5 percent from a year ago

Chinese President Xi Jinping hailed the smooth development of China-Germany relations by citing Newton's laws of motion during a meeting with German Chancellor Angela Merkel on the sidelines of a G20 summit.

Xi told Merkel, who got a doctorate degree in physics, that Newton's first law of motion, or law of inertia, applies to the cooperation between Beijing and Berlin. He urged both sides to unswervingly promote high-level exchanges and intergovernmental dialogues, so as to enhance strategic mutual trust for a constant advancement of bilateral cooperation.
Sea Jelly Spectacular in HK Ocean Park

Yang Dacai (C), former head of Shaanxi work safety administration, is on trial at the Xi'an Intermediate People's Court in Xi'an, capital of northwest China's Shaanxi Province, Sept. 5, 2013. Yang, who was found guilty of taking bribes and holding a large amount of property which he cannot account for, was sentenced to 14 years in prison on Thursday.Yang's precipitous plunge from grace began when images of him grinning merrily at the scene of a traffic accident which left 36 people dead appeared online in August of last year. Photographs soon surfaced online of Yang wearing luxury wristwatches, earning him the nickname "Brother Watch." The online anti-graft crusade soon led to an official inquiry.

The Metropolitan Museum of Art, located in New York City, is the largest art museum in the United States, and one of the ten largest in the world, with the most significant art collections. Its permanent collection contains more than two million works, divided among seventeen curatorial departments.
link_name: Inside the Metropolitan Museum of Art

status_message: Visitor views a woodcarved dog from Vietnam at the 10th China-ASEAN Expo in Nanning, capital of south China's Guangxi Zhuang Autonomous Region. Opened in Nanning on Tuesday, the expo attracted more than 2,300 companies from China and the Association of Southeast Asian Nations (ASEAN).
Visiting Chinese President Xi Jinping earths up a firry tree to commemorate the friendship between China and Turkmenistan in Ashkhabad, capital of Turkmenistan.

Bagel is New Yorkers' all-time favorite snacks, breakfast, or meal – whatever you call it. Usually one bagel is enough to stuff your stomach. But that's no longer the case. New York City has a grand opened place that sells only bite-size bagels. It comes with a variety of flavors and fillings such as cream cheese and peanut butter. Foodies can give their appetite a treat with several or a bunch of little tiny bagels. 
The place is located in West Village, Manhattan. As for now, there has not yet a long line of customers waiting outside, but it will.

The C-17 Globemaster III at Hindon Airforce Station, around 20 kms from Indian capital New Delhi, India. India inducted into its defense forces the world's biggest military transport plane, C-17 Globemaster III, in a bid to spruce up the country's Air Force's capability to move combat personnel and tanks to battle fronts as swiftly as possible.
The rainbow after a heavy rainfall in Shenyang, capital of northeast China's Liaoning Province.

Air force soldiers attend a commemorative activity to mark the 68th anniversary of China's victory over Japanese aggression as well as the end of World War II, in Nanjing, capital of east China's Jiangsu Province.
A huge historic mansion with a beautiful back garden located in Great Neck, Long Island in the U.S. Many big castles and mansions in this area were built in the Great Gatsby area. Jl
Paris Las Vegas is one popular landmark of the casino city. Built in 1999, the hotel has 2,916 rooms. Photo by tly.
Visiting the Headquarter of United Nation in New York. The meeting hall is open to tourists when there is no meeting from UN representatives. Jl

Staff from a pancake shop "Huang Tai Ji" cook stuffed pancake. The shop has generated an annual income of 7 million yuan ($1.14 million) and the founder He Chang planned to open 20 similar shops by 2015. The shop is located in Beijing. The food is popular among people. Basically, a pancake with two eggs is priced at 9.5 yuan ($1.6).

Workers sign on a Volkswagen passenger car, the first vehicle assembled on the production line of Shanghai Volkswagen Automotive Co's Xinjiang branch in Urumqi, capital of Northwest China's Xinjiang Uyghur Autonomous Region. The plant mainly manufactures "New Santana" sedan. The company invested 2 billion yuan ($327 million) in the production line and has an initial target of assembling 50,000 vehicles every year.

A police officer walks in front of a destroyed bus impounded from the accident scene at a police station in Ntulele town, near Narok, some 150 kilometers west of the capital Nairobi, Kenya. A bus carrying some 70 people crashed after the driver lost the control near the town of Ntulele, killing 41 people and wounding more than 33 people
Future car models designed by Royal College of Art students

Tourists from home and abroad amuse themselves on the Tiananmen Square in downtown Beijing. The Chinese capital, widely known for its heavy smog pollution over the last year, has seen its Air Quality Index stay below 50, a reading indicating "excellent air quality" for two days in a row.
Spectacular apartments with "musical instruments"
Unbelievable parents

Kwabena Adjei (C), national chairman of the ruling National Democratic Congress (NDC), walks out of Ghana's Supreme Court in Accra, capital city of Ghana. Ghana's Supreme Court by a 6-3 decision dismissed the 2012 election petition filed by three key personalities of the main opposition New Patriotic Party (NPP) against President John Dramani Mahama in Accra.
Residents hold national flags of Syria and Venezuela during a demonstration in support of Syria in front of Syrian Embassy in Caracas, Venezuela
PLA Navy finishes replenishment for the 1st time
Military training: 1st class in University

Following President Obama's Saturday announcement about his plan to seek congressional authorization for a strike against Syria, a small group of protesters rallied in Times Square against military action.
