status_message: Graffiti can be seen anywhere in Philadelphia, the U.S. It has become part of its culture there. Photo taken by tly in Philadelphia, U.S.

In shape, the hotel looks like a "Gold Brick", which has been found in Hai'an County of Jiangsu province, south China. There are 48 floors within this building with total investment of 2.45 billion U.S. dollars

Residents attend the funeral of the victims trapped by a landslide in the municipality of Yecautla, Veracruz, Mexico. A total of 13 persons were killed, nine of them in Yecuatla, after the heavy rain caused by the tropical strom Fernand
A tourist boat rides on the Lake Bled in northwestern Slovenia. The beautiful glacial lake is a popular tourist destination about 55km from the capital city Ljubljana.

Citizens choose muskmelons during a promotion event in Beijing. Tonnes of muskmelons grown in west China's Xinjiang Uygur Autonomous Region rolled into Beijing on Wednesday, as a local government strives to help farmers boost sales.

The court trial of Bo Xilai (C, front) at Jinan Intermediate People's Court in Jinan, capital of east China's Shandong Province. The trial of Bo, charged with bribery, embezzlement and abuse of power, concluded at 1:04 p.m. Monday at the court. The verdict will be announced at a date yet to be decided.

A shopkeeper shows a bangle at the Teej Fair for the upcoming Teej festival in Kathmandu, Nepal. The Teej festival, celebrated once a year, generally falls in the month of August or early September. It is the festival of affection between husband and wife as well as among women.
Preview of Moscow air show
Three marmots are eating at the Cuopugou scenic area in southwest China's Sichuan Province

In this photo released by Smithsonian's National Zoo the giant panda cub born 5:32 p.m. August 23 at the Zoo receives an exam from animal care staff in Washington D.C. Aug. 25, 2013. The cub, which weighs 137 grams (about 4.83 ounces), is robust, repoted the zoo's chief veterinarian Suzan Murray. It has a steady heartbeat, a full belly (is nursing well) and has successfully passed fecals. It will take approximately 2-3 weeks before the sex is known.
"Swan ship", so cozy
Tourists enjoy themselves on the beach of the Wuzhizhou Island in Sanya, south China's Hainan Province

Zydrunas Savickas of Lithuania undergoes the super yoke competition with 1,050 pounds on the shoulder during the final of the 2013 World's Strongest Man competition in Sanya, south China's Hainan Province
U.S. President Barack Obama kisses a baby after speaking at SUNY Buffalo

Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi on Thursday urged New Zealand to properly resolve the botulism contamination crisis at its dairy giant Fonterra.

During talks with New Zealand Foreign Affairs Minister Murray McCully, Wang said safety scares involving New Zealand dairy exports have attracted extensive public attention in China.

Fonterra has been the subject of two international food safety alerts this month, with the worst case being whey protein concentrate shipped to customers at home and abroad contaminated with bacteria that can cause botulism.
Visitors play games at the Gamescom 2013 gaming trade fair in Cologne, Germany. Gamescom 2013 gaming trade fair, Europe's largest one of its kind, runs from August 21 to August 25.

Government employees shout slogans as Indian police spray colored water on them during a protest in Srinagar, summer capital of Indian-controlled Kashmir. The employees demanded release of their arrears, salary hike and regularization of their jobs.

Pakistani soldiers patrol outside a polling station during the country's by-election in southern Pakistani port city of Karachi. Voting started in Pakistan's by-elections on Thursday that will test popularity of the ruling and opposition parties.

Vehicles are stranded on the damaged in south China's Guangxi Zhuang Autonomous Region. Landslides and road accidents has disrupted the traffic since Aug. 17, leaving 68 vehicles and over 130 people still trapped now on the highway.

A Bedouin man jumps over camels during celebrations marking the Sanaa Summer Festival in Sanaa, Yemen. The two-week festival kicked off on Tuesday aiming at boosting tourism in this unrest-ridden Arab country.

Voting in Pakistan's by- elections ended Thursday afternoon and the authorities started counting in the presence of the polling agents of the candidates.

Polling was relatively peaceful and there had been minor scuffle of supporters of political rivals at some constituencies.
A farmer sprays pesticide at a paddy field in Tancheng County of Linyi City, east China's Shandong Province.

The Indian rupee experienced a continuous drop against the U.S. dollar in recent days. Though India has been witnessing fast economic growth, financial experts said that the rupee weakened mainly due to international investors pulling money out of Indian shares and debts.

Drug trafficker Sandra Avila Beltran (R), known as "Queen of the Pacific", arriving at the International Airport, in Mexico City, Mexico. Sandra Avila Beltran was repatriated from the U.S. and will be transferred to a maximum security prison in Mexican state of Jalisco.
Pakistani President Asif Ali Zardari shaking hands with Thailand's Prime Minister Yingluck Shinawatra at president palace in Islamabad, capital of Pakistan.

Farmers sort out grapes Tuesday in East China's Shandong Province. As the peak season for grape, apples and pears approaches, farmers cooperate with fruit stores and supermarkets in the county to bring their fruits in the market before the Chinese ghost festival, on the 15th day of the seventh lunar month which falls on Wednesday this year. Local people have the tradition of tasting seasonal fruits in the festival, which will double local fruit consumption during the period.

Japanese Ground Self-Defense Forces helicopters fly over armored vehicles during an annual live fire exercise at the Higashi-Fuji firing range in Gotemba, at the foot of Mt. Fujiin Shizuoka prefecture on Tuesday. The annual drill involves some 2,400 personnel, 80 tanks and armored vehicles and 30 aircrafts and helicopters.
Just for a laugh
Nubian ibexes are seen in the Negev Desert near Israeli southern town of Mizpe Ramon. The Nubian ibex is a desert-dwelling goat species found in mountainous areas..
A restaurant in London founded by four university students is famous for its unique insect dishes.

Photo taken with a mobile phone shows a bus which is cordoned off after a robbery incident happened in Anyang City, central China's Henan Province, Aug. 19, 2013. Two people have been killed and another 13 injured after a knife-wielding man attempted to rob the bus Monday afternoon.
Flooded Heping Town in Shantou City, south China's Guangdong Province. Severe rainstorms ravaged the city of Shantou for the last few days, causing inundation and huge damage.

Pacific Grove is a coastal city in Monterey County, California, USA. Pacific Grove is known for its Victorian homes, Asilomar State Beach, its artistic legacy and also known as the "Butterfly Capital of California" for the annual migration of the Monarch butterflies.

Dubbed as the "first fairy mountain of Jiangxi", Sanqing Mountain is situated at the border of Shangrao City and Dexing City in Jiangxi Province. It is a sacred place for Taoists and also famous for its granite forests, gorges and unique ecological scenes.
A model displays an Italian creation during the 2013 Guangdong Fashion Week in Guangzhou. The twelve-day fashion week kicked off Friday.
Smoke rises from the workshop where a fire broke out in east China's Anhui Province. A factory of the Anhui Wanwei Group Company Limited caught fire on Thursday night, with casualties unknown yet.

Free zumba dance class being held in Herald Square at 34th Street near Macy's flagship store in New York. Photo shows a girl was learning the steps from a dancer. Photo taken on August 14, 2013 in Manhattan, New York.
A matador was gored by a bull during a bullfight in Madrid, capital of Spain on August 15, 2013.

Authorities initiated an emergency disaster relief response in northeast China's Heilongjiang Province on Friday due to floods that have killed 11 people since Aug. 10. Photo shows houses are submerged by floodwater in northeast China's Heilongjiang Province.

Egyptian women mourn over their dead relative in Al-Eman mosque, where 361 protester's bodies lay in lines, in Cairo's Nasr City, Egypt. Hundreds were killed and thousands others injured across Egypt in clashes between supporters of ousted President Mohamed Morsi and the security troops, after the latter dispersed Wednesday two pro-Morsi sit-ins in the country.

Alimihan Seyiti, a 127-year-old woman in Shule County in northwest China's Xinjiang Uygur Autonomous Region, is considered to be the oldest person around the world. Seyiti born on June 25, 1886, likes singing love songs and drinking cold water.

A local villager carries wood from a waterlogged field in south China's Guangdong Province. Downpour brought by typhoon Utor, which made its landfall in Guangdong Wednesday, caused overflow of the Meihuajiang River running through Zhanjiang Thursday.
Ger districts in the outskirts of Ulaanbaatar, capital of Mongolia. The herdsmen poured into the urban Yearning for city life. cf

Egyptians in New York protesting in front of the building of Mission to the UN with signs showing ousted President Mohamed Morsi. Photo taken on August 14, 2013 in Manhattan, New York. 
As of Wednesday, at least 525 people were killed and 3,717 others injured across Egypt in clashes between supporters of ousted President Mohamed Morsi and the security troops.
link_name: Egyptians in NYC protesting in front of UN buildings

status_message: Members of several social groups parade towards the Japanese Consulate General in south China's Hong Kong, Aug. 15, 2013. Thursday marks the 68th anniversary of Japan's surrender to the Allies and China's victory on Japan's aggression war in 1945. Local activists in Hong Hong organzied a parade to commemorate the historic event and protest against Japanese militarism in front of Japanese Consulate General here Thursday.

Farmers clean up ripening towel gourds Wednesday in a field in East China's Jiangxi Province. The county has taken various favorable policies to bolster contract farming, which brings in revenues totaling more than 2 billion yuan ($327 million) per annum. Contract farming refers to the facilitating of contract agreements between buyers and farmers.
Vulcano specially designed for China's consumers
Little amateur performers of Peking Opera perform in Tianjin, north China. Little amateur performers of Peking Opera attending a national competition staged a performance on Monday evening.

The 80 bridesmaids and a couple of page boys form the shape of a heart for the wedding of Katie Dalby, 26, a dance teacher and Norman Gooch, 37, a firefighter in Harwich, Essex. Dance teacher Katie Dalby picked all her pupils from Katie's Boogie Shoes Dance Academy to be bridesmaids aged two to 17, three sisters-in-law, a niece, a cousin and her best friend at her wedding.
Bisexual faces! Beauty or disaster?

Waxwork models of Britain's Prince William and his wife Catherine are placed in front of the Yellow Crane Tower during a promotional event in Wuhan, Hubei province, the Qixi Festival, or Chinese Valentine's Day.

Aircraft of Breitling Jet Team, a famous European aerobatic team, perform above the Jiayuguan Pass in northwest China's Gansu Province. The team will also give performance in northwest China's Xinjiang Uygur Autonomous Region during its tour in China.
A Pakistani man paints a child's face at a roadside stall on the eve of Pakistan's Independence Day in eastern Pakistan's Lahore. Pakistan will celebrate its Independence Day on Aug. 14.

Rescuers and journalists work in front of the big wheel known as "Around the World" or "Wheel of fortune" after an accident at the International Park funfair in Rosario, Argentina. Two people died and many other got injured, including three children who were taken to hospital.
Pakistani people buy national flags ahead of Pakistan's Independence Day in northwest Pakistan's Peshawar. Pakistan will celebrate its Independence Day on Aug. 14.
Invisible naked man with flip flops – spotted in Copenhagen

Lin Dan (back) of China returns a shuttlecock during men's single final match against Lee Chong Wei of Malaysia at the 2013 BWF World Championships in Guangzhou, capital of south China's Guangdong Province, Aug. 11, 2013. Lin Dan claimed the title as Lee Chong Wei retired in the match.
Can you tell which one is a shoe and which one is an eggplant?
Tourists stroll on a beach in Penglai, a popular tourist destination of east China's Shandong Province

Pakistani Muslims offer Eid al-Fitr prayers outside a mosque during the first day of their religious festival in northwest Pakistan's Peshawar. Muslims around the world are celebrating the Eid al-Fitr holiday, which marks the end of the fasting month of Ramadan.
Italian architect David Fisher has designed a series of rotating skyscrapers for cities including London, Paris, Dubai and Moscow.

An African woman walks past stalls in downtown Guangzhou, South China's Guangdong Province, on Sunday. The area is referred to as "Chocolate City" or "Brooklyn in Guangzhou" by natives, because of the large African community. The economic boom in the city has drawn many African traders to migrate to the southern metropolis.

Tourists gesture for photos during the 17th Berlin Beer Festival at the Karl Marx Avenue in Berlin, Germany Kicked off on Friday, the three day annual international Beer Festival attracted some 330 breweries from 86 countries and regions in Berlin.

Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe bows during the annual memorial ceremony of the atomic bombing at the Peace Memoral Park in Hiroshima, Japan, Aug. 6, 2013. Hiroshima marked the 68th anniversary of the western Japanese city's atomic bombing on Tuesday morning with representatives from 70 countries and the European Union, calling for a world order based on trust and dialogue.

A baby rescued by police from an infant trafficking in central China's Henan Province. On July 17, a gynecologist surnamed Zhang from a hospital in northwest China's Shaanxi Province, allegedly sold the newborn to a man and woman from neighboring Shanxi Province for 21,600 yuan (3,494 U.S. dollars). Police found that Zhang lied to the mother of the baby born on July 16, telling the mother that her child had a congenital infectious disease and disability, then the gynecologist tricked the mother into letting her handle the baby.
A competitor participates in the King and Queen Competition and Show of the 2013 Toronto Caribbean Carnival in Toronto, Canada.
Artists create a Chinese painting during a painting and calligraphy event in Beijing. Some 30 artists, both disabled and not disabled, participated in the event on Friday.

Indonesian children hold anti-Israel and anti-US signs during a demonstration in Jakarta, Indonesia. Hundreds of demonstrators took to the streets of Jakarta on Al-Quds Day, the last Friday of the Islamic holy month of Ramadan, to show support for the Palestinian people and to emphasize the importance of Jerusalem to Muslims.
The landslide site in southwest China's Yunnan Province. A landslide that occurred early Friday here disrupted trains on a railway. One railway worker was killed in the landslide.

A prefectural officer culls chickens at a poultry farm with a suspected bird flu outbreak in Nangkhel village on the outskirts of Kathmandu on Thursday. Nepal on Thursday banned the sale of chicken after health workers found cases of bird flu at several poultry farms on the outskirts of the capital.

Technicians prepare to make artificial precipitation in Lianxu Township of Qidong County, central China's Hunan Province. As of July 31, lingering droughts have affected many parts in Hunan. Nearly 1.29 million people lack adequate supplies of drinking water, and a total of 786,000 hectares of farmland is damaged by the drought.

Young ladies of the Bai ethnic group perform their traditional dancing during the opening ceremony of the 5th Dali International Photography Exhibition in Dali, southwest China's Yunnan Province. The five-day exhibition, which kicked off on Thursday, will display more than 6,000 photography works through over 200 themed exhibitions.
Located just west of the Forbidden City and Jingshan Park, Beihai Park is one of the oldest, largest, and best-preserved of all the ancient imperial gardens in China.

Two models were on hand for a private helicopter show, staged for the launch of a property project in Xuchang, Henan province. Professional flight crews also showed up to deliver live commentary at the event on Sunday.
Chinese patrol and search-and-rescue vessel "Haixun 01" arrives in Pelaboham Kelang in Malaysia. The "Haixun 01" arrived in Pelaboham Kelang Wednesday for a five-day visit.
The Tianchi Lake on the Changbai Mountain in Yanbian Korean Autonomous Prefecture, northeast China's Jilin Province. The Changbai Mountain in Jilin Province has entered a high season of tourism.
Chinese veterans attend the celebrating ceremony to mark the 60th anniversary of the Korean War Armistice Agreement in Pyongyang, the Democratic People's Republic of Korea (DPRK), on July 29, 2013.
Dozens of birds resting on a lamp pole in New York. Photo taken on July 30, 2013 in Queens, New York. Jl

A pilot falls into the Moskva river on his "flying duck" during the Red Bull Flugtag competition in Moscow on Sunday. Flugtag is an event in which competitors attempt to fly homemade machines, which are usually launched off a pier into the sea, or a suitably sized reservoir of water.
Attendees wearing inflated sumo suits run for a charity competition held on July 28, 2013, in London.
Models display the collection of Indian fashion designer Tarun Tahiliani at India Bridal Fashion Week in New Delhi, #India.

A man in South Korea said that he would jump from a bridge on social network on July 25, 2013; and he did commit suicide on July 26, 2013. KBS Television captured the whole process with camera, which raised moral arguments about news coverage.
These twins are the great fruits for summer

A burned oil truck is seen in Parwan province of Afghanistan on July 29, 2013. Earlier on Monday, an oil truck was set on fire after a sticky bomb attached to the vehicle was detonated by militants in eastern Parwan province. At least two people were injured and a house caught fire in the incident which took place in Charikar city, 60 km north of Kabul, local media reported.

Costumed revelers parade during annual Multicultural Caribbean Days Parade in North Vancouver, BC, Canada on July 27, 2013. The Caribbean Days Parade, part of Caribbean Days Festival, one of the biggest events of its kind in Canada, celebrated Caribbean culture and style.
Daredevil Oliver Furrer has taken his thrill-seeking to new heights - by 'surfing' the clouds on a snowboard.

This handout photo released by the Egyptian Army on July 27, 2013, shows pro-military protesters gathering at the Tahrir Square, in Cairo, Egypt, on July 26, 2013. Millions of Egyptians held mass rallies and parade to show their attitude around the country on Friday. Death toll of clashes erupted late Friday between supporters and opponents of Egypt's ousted president Mohamed Morsi has climbed to at least 139 on Saturday, the Muslim Brotherhood (MB) and local media said.
Tourists cool off in a water park in Shanghai on July 28, 2013. The highest temperature reached 39 degrees Celsius in Shanghai on Sunday.
Has anyone played with this toy? Do you know how to play?

Pope Francis speaks as he meets with Argentine youngsters at the Metropolitan Cathedral in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. Pope Francis urged young Brazilians not to despair in the battle against corruption Thursday as he addressed their country's political problems in the wake of massive protests. Pope Francis, the first Latin American and Jesuit pontiff, arrived in Brazil mainly for the huge five-day Catholic gathering World Youth Day.

Sudhakar Yadav has been making cars himself since he was 14 years old. After 30 years, he has made 700 cars with unique appearances that are able to be driven on roads. He even built his own car museum.
A New Yorker is feeding dozens of birds by a road in Midtown. There are 476 species of wild bird documented in New York State. Photo taken on July 25 in Manhattan. Jl
A foreign tourist handstands on a wheelchair Wednesday at Tiananmen Square in Beijing.

People dressed as Santa Claus participate in a parade during the annual World Santa Claus Congress in Copenhagen, Denmark. Santa Johnny from China's Hong Kong won the "World Best Santa Claus" on Wednesday.

A tourist feeds a two-month-old little tiger in Yunnan Wild Animal Park in Kunming, capital of southwest China's Yunnan Province, July 25, 2013. Tourists are allowed to contact with the 11 little tigers in the animal park since Thursday.

Customers are attracted by artistic watermelons in Xiangyang, Hubei province. A 30-year-old fruit dealer, carves vivid flowers like peonies and roses as well as other patterns on the melons. The price for each melon is 20 yuan ($3.26) to 50 yuan.
Fire breaks out at Carrefour supermarket in Beijing

Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi (R) meets with #Pakistan's Ambassador to China Masood Khalid in Beijing, capital of China, July 24, 2013, receiving a humanitarian donation of one million U.S. dollars from the Pakistani government to quake-hit areas in #China. A 6.6-magnitude quake hit northwest China's Gansu Province on Monday morning, leaving 95 dead.

Employees of Japan's Tsukuba City Hall ride on Toyota's transport assistance robot, the "Winglet," during a demonstration in City Hall in Tsukuba City, Japan. Toyota and Tsukuba City have started to field test the "personal mobility robot" on public thoroughfares, with trial runs scheduled until 2016.
A polar bear bites a tire in Wuhan Haichang Polar Ocean World in Hubei Province. Rumor has it that the park's two polar bears were starved, which the zoo keepers have denied.

A customer pumps gas at a Chevron gas station on Monday in San Francisco, California. According to the American Automobile Association, the national average price for a gallon of regular gasoline rose to $3.67 as prices surged 12 cents in the past week following unrest in Egypt and production disruptions at US refineries.

Indian candidates undergo punishment as others wait for measurements during a physical fitness test at an Indian army recruitment rally at Khasa, some 15 kilometers from Amritsar. The Indian army is a voluntary service and the world's largest standing volunteer army, with over 1 million active personnel and just under 1 million in reserve.
Mixed-blood model shines at Nanning Auto Show

A European Union regulation on toys took full effect on Saturday, setting stricter restrictions on chemical content of toys, putting pressure on Chinese toy makers. China is the world's biggest toy producer and exporter, taking a two-third share of the international market.
Beautiful children models
Tourists ride water bike at the Wanpingkou bathing beach in Rizhao, east China's Shandong Province. A large amount of tourists come here to enjoy the coolness brought by sea.
Passers-by look at the damage caused to several vehicles after a storefront collapsed in Shenyang, Liaoning Province
Horses graze as they prepare for the horse racing festival in West Ujimqin Banner, in Xilin Gol League, North China's Inner Mongolia autonomous region.

China's first Hello Kitty theme restaurant was launched in the capital. Expectedly, it's all pink and sweet inside the restaurant, authorized by the Japanese parent company Sanrio. The tablecloth is pink, as are the chairs, ceiling and floor, even the lamp light shines soft and rosy. Waiters are in white shirts with a red bow and blue rompers, while waitresses wear pink dresses. Dining at Hello Kitty Dreams Restaurant, which opened on Dec 23 at Sanlitun Village shopping zone in Beijing, costs 160 yuan ($25) on average per person. Sanlitun Village is regarded as one of the city's most charming areas, lined with bars and international brand-name stores.

A restaurant in Qingdao has developed a whole line of dishes that include algae, while local authorities are spending a great deal of time and effort trying to wipe out the seaweed. Restaurant manager Ma Hui said the sauteed egg-algae pancake and algae duck soup are the most popular dishes.
The algae, enteromorpha prolifera, which have appeared in huge blooms in the coastal waters around the Shandong province city every summer since 2008, have become a burden for local agencies cleaning up beaches. The organisms have had an adverse effect on the ocean environment and local tourism during the peak season in July and August.

South Africa High Commission staff Helen Mashele tells stories on Mandela's long walk to freedom to students at Kilimani Primary School in Nairobi, capital of Kenya. A variety of activities, including tree planting, library wall painting and storytelling on Mandela's long walk to freedom, were held here on Thursday to celebrate Nelson Mandela Day. The theme for this year is "Take Action, Inspire Change and Make Every Day a Mandela Day."
Her butt can be a table top.

A photo released by Zoo Atlanta on Tuesday shows twin panda cubs born at the zoo in Atlanta, Georgia Monday to Lun Lun, a 15-year-old giant panda. The first of the tiny duo arrived at 6:21 pm, and its twin followed at 6:23 pm. The cubs are the first giant pandas to be born in the US in 2013 and the first twins to be born in the US since 1987.

Elements of the Mexican Navy watch over the Assistant Attorney General's Office for Special Investigations on Organized Crime after the capture of the aleged Drug Lord, Miguel Angel Trevino Morales, in Mexico City, Mexico. The leader of the Zetas' Cartel, Miguel Angel Trevino Morales, also known as the Z-40, was captured on Monday's morning by members of the Mexican Navy, near Nuevo Laredo, Tamaulipas.

A wailing woman with her dead child are seen at a hospital in Chapra district of eastern Indian state of Bihar. Nine children died and 40 children have been admitted to a local hospital in Chapra district as a result of food-poisoning from the free mid-day meal provided at their school.

The 13th Beijing Dance Competition, jointly organzied by the Beijing Federation of Literary and Art Circles and the Beijing Dancers Association, came to an end at the Beijing Guoan Theater. The biennial event was joined by more than 2,000 performers.

A woman from Ning'an, Northeast China's Heilongjiang Province, harvests Pepquino melon, a species from South America. The three-centimeter-long fruit, dubbed the "thumb watermelon," tastes slightly sweet. Specialized local farming cooperatives planted only 200 strains of the fruit this year, and plan to farm more next year due to the good market reception. The first batch hit the market at a price of 160 yuan ($26.10) per kilogram.

A villager collecting the corns in Yixu Village of Dahua Yao Autonomous County, south China's Guangxi Zhuang Autonomous Region. Benefiting from good climate, about 108,000 hectares of summer grain in Guangxi entered the harvest season recently.

Protesters take part in a demonstration to protest George Zimmerman's acquittal in the shooting death of Florida teen Trayvon Martin, in Los Angeles, California. A Jury in U.S. state Florida on July 13 acquitted George Zimmerman, who shot and killed Seventeen-year-old African American teenager Trayvon Martin on Feb. 26, 2012, in a case which sparked heated debate on race and guns.

A woman whips a participant crawling on the ground under barbed wire during a mud endurance competition in Zhangjiakou, Hebei Province on Sunday. This is the first time a mud competition was held in the country.

The Russian flag on the state duma building flies at half mast mourning the fatal crash on July 13 in Moscow, Russia, July 15, 2013. 18 people were killed and other 61 injured after a truck carrying concrete ran into a passenger bus in an outlying area of Moscow. Moscow government declared a mourning day on Monday.
People wade through flooded streets after heavy rain in eastern Pakistan's Lahore. Rain brought coolness to Lahore slashed by recent summer heat.
Players of the ORC class compete on the last day of the South American Championship at the Rolex Ilhabela Sailing Week 2013 in Ilhabela, Brazil, on July 13, 2013.

Giant waves surge up against the shoreline of Diaobin fishing port in Wenling city, East China's Zhejiang province. China's Central Meteorological Observatory issued a yellow-level wave warning for Typhoon Soulik on Friday morning, saying the super typhoon is moving northwest at a speed of 22 km/h. Soulik is forecast to approach Taiwan's east coast and affect waters off the mainland's coastal provinces of Zhejiang and Fujian.
A local resident takes photos of the sunset by the Wanquan River in Qionghai City, south China's Hainan Province
The vessel "Atrevida" participates in the Ilhabela Sailing Week 2013 in Ilhabela, Brazil. The regatta of Wednesday was a medium path around the Buzios Island, northeast of Ilhabela.
Workers of Cvirn Printing Company make EU flags for Croatia's EU entry celebration in Zagreb, capital of Croatia. Croatia is set to become the 28th member state of the European Union on July 1, 2013.

Every corner of New York City is a perfect backdrop for photo shoot. Video taken on June 27, 2013 shows models in bikini cat walking on top of a building. But can you ever guess that the reality of all those sexy, glamorous productions is merely shot from a shabby roof of an old building?
Subway stations are almost the crime hub in New York City. Photo taken on June 27, 2013 shows a cop interrogating a handcuffed suspect in one subway station, Manhattan.

A man harvests a pumpkin on the roof of his house Wednesday in Jinhua, East China's Zhejiang Province. He has grown more than 20 kinds of vegetables on the 140-square-meter roof, mainly for family consumption. Although recent data from the National Bureau of Statistics showed vegetable prices in China dropped by 1.9 percent year-on-year in May, growing vegetables at home has become a trend due to growing concerns over food safety.
Creative corn cob holder

A policeman stands guard during a confiscated narcotics destroying activity held in Ayutthaya province, Thailand. More than 3,000 kilograms of illicit drug, seized by Thai authority, were set ablaze on Wednesday to mark the International Day Against Drug Abuse and Illicit Trafficking.

A Zimbabwean primary school student has his first try at writing Chinese characters using a brush pen in the Chinese Embassy in the north suburb of Harare, capital of Zimbabwe, on June 26. Chinese Ambassador Lin Lin said the "opening gate" event hosted by the embassy aims to promote Chinese culture to Zimbabweans, especially the younger generation, who have little exposure to various Chinese culture.

A wax statue of Michael Jackson stands center stage as part of an exhibit memorializing the pop superstar at Madame Tussauds Wax Museum in Shanghai, marking the 4th anniversary of his death. The exhibit, organized in part with the Shanghai Michael Jackson Fan Club, included nearly 300 pieces of memorabilia from personal collections and live performances. Jackson would have turned 55 this year.

Agricultural equipment donated by the Buddhist Association of China are displayed during a donation ceremony in Nay Pyi Taw, capital of Myanmar. The Buddhist Association of China on Tuesday provided a total of 55 sets of agricultural equipment including five trucks to Myanmar Ministry of Agriculture as a donation aimed at assisting the country's agricultural sector.

Actress Angelina Jolie, the Special Envoy of the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR), attends a UN Security Council meeting at the UN headquarters in New York. Jolie on Monday urged the UN Security Council to tackle sexual violence in war zones, promoting strong actions from the international community on this issue.

34-year-old man completed tightrope walk near Grand Canyon. Aerialist Nik Wallenda walked on a 2-inch-thick steel cable, 1,500 feet above the river, without wearing a harness. He said his next try would be a tightrope walk between the Empire State building and the Chrysler building in New York.
Brazil matches against Italy in Confederations Cup

A visitor views the displayed photographic works during the Karl Largerfeld's photographic exhibition named "The Little Black Jacket" in Shanghai, east China, June 21, 2013. Karl Largerfeld is a distinguished designer for famous luxury brand CHANEL. The photographic exhibition was officially opened to the public Friday.

Rescuers work at the site of collapsed four-storey building in suburban Dahisar on the outskirts of Mumbai, on June 22, 2013. The building collapsed on Saturday caused five people dead and several wounded.
People play on a water square in Pingnan County, Ningde City, southeast China's Fujian Province, June 21, 2013.

Boats displayed during the 26th annual summer boat show in Houston, the U.S. An annual boat event was unveiled in Houston Thursday. The event offers a vast selection of boats ranging from kayaks to yachts, from the latest high-tech fishing rigs to high-performance water sports machines.

Buddhist monks pay homage to the Sakyamuni tooth-relic stupa replica from China at the Shwedagon Pagoda in Yangon, Myanma. A grand religious ceremony of handover and enshrinement of a Sakyamuni tooth-relic stupa replica from China was held at the Shwedagon Pagoda in Myanmar's Yangon Friday.
Female pilots of Pakistan Air Force

Burritos as big as babies. A Mexican restaurant in Seattle has sparked a bizarre photo trend, which sees newborns posed up alongside giant plates of burritos. It says that any diners who take photos of their babies next to one of the restaurant's staggering Burrito Grande plates can eat for free. The only catch: The child must be less than one month old.
Some 600 students exercise with reanimation dolls in Lingen, Germany in an attempt to set a new record on reanimating simultaneously.
Egg carving in China

Two sisters, locked in an iron cage on top of a tricycle, peep outside on Tuesday in Liuzhou, Guangxi Zhuang Autonomous Region. The cage, built by their grandmother, is for their safety while riding on the back of the trike.

Stamps are becoming obsolete ever since the invention of Internet. The days that we anticipate real letters with stamps on from friends and parents are long gone. But that makes stamps more precious to collectors. Photo taken on June 19, 2013 shows a set of Pakistan stamps from a stamp collector.  jl
Lion brothers fight to steal spotlight

Bill to third party
An AT&T customer found on June 17 that his Nokia Lumia920 phone was dead. The device support center of AT&T found the phone's data cable wasn't working and placed an order for the customer. But seconds later the worker realized the armor was dead also, so he placed another order of travel charger. The customer received the parts in 2 seperate Fedex packages the next morning. On the package it says "Bill to third party", which is Nokia. Putting efficiency aside, AT&T could have saved Nokia more than US$30 of courier fee by merging the orders into one single package.This is AT&T,in USA. jm

A family watches a film in car in the open-air drive-in theatre in a self-drive encampment near Wuyi Mountain, southeast China's Fujian Province, June 17, 2013. The first 3D drive-in theatre of the Fujian Province opened here recently, which occupies 5,000 square meters and can accommodate 86 cars.
A modified Mazda car displayed with its scissor door opened at the "All in Tuning All in Caravanning" Show China 2013 at the China National Convention Center, Beijing.

Chen Deqiang is surrounded by his anole pets at home in Liuzhou, south China's Guangxi Zhuang Autonomous Region. Chen had his first pet anole more than one year ago, and now the number has reached 36. As the amount of anoles keeps on growing, he even built a special "house" for them.

There are two free newspaper in New York City, amNewYork and Metro, available in subway and bus stops every morning.
Both of them target young and professionals, providing them a 20-minutes read with mini bites of news that are free and easy read. photo by JM

Recently retired football player David Beckham takes part in a training session with students at Nanjing Olympic Center in Nanjing, east China's Jiangsu Province. Beckham is on a seven-day visit to China as the ambassador for the Football Programme in China and China's Super League.

link_name: Training photos of China's aircraft carrier

status_message: A Pakistani mother takes care of her child suffering from measles at a hospital in eastern Pakistan's Lahore.

A dolphin stranded near beach; swimmers offered no help but taking pics. The dolphin got stranded near a beach in Sanya, Hainan, Guangdong Province of China, but before official rescuers arrived, swimmers hovered over, held up the dying dolphin, and took pics of themselves.
Horses graze by the Yamzhog Yumco Lake in Shannan Prefecture, southwest China's Tibet Autonomous Region, June 16, 2013.

Manila hosts photo show featuring Japanese army's barbarity. A veteran of anti-japanese guerrilla of overseas Chinese in the Philippines visits a photo exhibition featuring the brutal acts of Japanese army during World War II in Manila, the Phillipines. The photo exhibition kicked off on Friday and will last for ten days.

Visitors view works at a calligraphy exhibition held to mark the 140 anniversary for the birth of Liang Qichao, a well-known Chinese thinker, politician and educator in the late Qing Dynasty (1644-1911), in Xinhui District, Jiangmen, south China's Guangdong Province. Xinhui is Liang's native place.

People lining up for cheap fast food can be seen commonly in the US, a sign that shows the US economy is still struggling. Photo taken on June 14, 2013 shows a fast food store near 5th Avenue is promoting a US$0.99 meal for 2 eggs on a roll to attract customers.

Former French president Valery Giscard d'Estaing visits a photo exhibition on China-France relationship at Xinhua Gallery in Paris, France. The photo exhibition opened on Thursday, to mark the 50th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic relations between China and France in 2014.

Chicken farmers scuffle with police during a demonstration outside the Council of Agriculture in Taipei on Thursday. Some 2,000 chicken farmers threw rotten eggs and scuffled with police during a demonstration to demand the government provide better slaughter services to go along with the ban on killing poultry in traditional markets.

18 finalists arrive in Sydney are to compete for Best Jobs in World, including the Chief Funster in New South Wales, Lifestyle Photographer in Melbourne, Outback Adventurer in Northern Territory, Park Ranger in Queensland, Taste Master in Western Australia, and Wildlife Caretaker in South Australia.

Photo taken on June 13, 2013 shows the screen at the Beijing Aerospace Control Center showing Nie Haisheng (L) helping Zhang Xiaoguang to stand after entering the Tiangong-1 space module. China's Shenzhou-10 manned spacecraft successfully completed an automated docking with the orbiting Tiangong-1 space module at 1:18 p.m.

Photos show the flooding on the Danube river in Grein, a village in northern Austria. The flood walls, temporarily built right before the rise of water, have done a great job in preventing further damage. But these walls are costly. Called Spundwand, the 11km-walls cost 11 million euros.

Farmers weave cat and dog furniture from wheat stalks in Tancheng county, East China's Shandong Province on Wednesday. Around the wheat harvest, local farmers use wheat byproduct stalks to make handicrafts for export. The county produces one million pieces of handicraft annually.

People visit an exhibition showcasing serial pictures created by He Youzhi on love stories at the Zhejiang Art Museum in Hangzhou, east China's Zhejiang Province. The exhibition kicked off here Wednesday, where the serial picture master displayed his works created since 1949.

An Afghan child takes a rest on a cart at a brick factory in Kabul, Afghanistan on June 12, 2013， which was the World Day Against Child Labor observed around the world. But Afghan labor children work as usual on June 12.

Tippi Benjamine Okanti Degré was nicknamed "Mowgli" for her adventures in the wild. She spent her early life much like Mowgli, the child character who was raised with wild animals in Rudyard Kipling's famous book, "The Jungle Book".

A torched NATO supply truck is seen after an attack by militants in northwest Pakistan's Jamrud. At least five people were killed when unknown militants opened fire at two NATO containers in Pakistan's northwest tribal area of Khyber Agency Monday morning.

People take part in the annual World Naked Bike Ride in central London, Britain over the weekend. Naked cyclists protested against oil dependency and car culture, raising awareness of cycling as an environmentally friendly option.

Chinese professional basketball player Yi Jianlian complained in his own social blog that he had found a curly hair in his half-eaten KFC burger. Fans all agreed it was a human body hair. KFC immediately issue an apology, and clarified that was the material from an insulated glove. If this complaint came from an ordinary consumer, would KFC react so swiftly? jl

Thai-U.S. navy exercise codenamed "CARAT", or Cooperation Afloat Readiness and Training, is held at Had Yao beach in Chonburi province, Thailand. The exercise involving nearly 3,000 service men from both sides, was aimed at training maritime security initiatives, including skills to combate seaborne terrorism threats and transnational crimes at sea.

A man presents his well-preserved racing car during a grand exhibition of the classic vintage cars, on the Kurfuerstendamm Avenue, in Berlin, Germany, June 8, 2013. Some 2,000 well-preserved and well-functioning classic vintage cars and limousines at least over 50-year-old are exhibited at the fair, with the motto "when luxury meets classics".

Investigation of bus fire in Xiamen underway
Investigators work inside the debris of a burned bus in Xiamen, southeast China's Fujian Province, early June 8, 2013. The bus fire happening in Xiamen on Friday evening has claimed 47 lives and hospitalized 34 passgengers. An old man who allegedly set fire to the crowded bus to "vent personal grievances" had died in the blaze, local authorities said Saturday. Chen Shuizong, born in 1954 and a native of Xiamen, was identified as the arsonist of the fire.

A female student fainted 20 mins before the college entrance exam began in Sichuan, China. A male student at the same examination site saw that and ran to rescue her. He picked up the girl and sent her to a hospital, before returning to the exam. We don't know how well this boy did in the exam; all we know is he's a hero. JL
Jackie Chan leaves imprints in front of the TCL Chinese Theatre in Hollywood, California on June 6, 2013.
Chinese President Xi Jinping and his U.S. counterpart, Barack Obama, met Friday to exchange views on major issues of common concern.
link_name: In pictures: Xi, Obama meet for 1st summit

status_message:
Obama received Xi upon his arrival, and the two heads of state greeted each other.
At the beginning of the meeting, Xi thanked Obama for his invitation, saying that he was glad to hold talks with the U.S. president at Sunnylands.
"Sunnylands is close to the Pacific Ocean, and China is just on the other side of the ocean," Xi said.
Xi recalled his visit to the United States last year when he said that the vast Pacific Ocean has enough room to accommodate the development of two great powers in the world, namely China and the United States.
"Today I meet here with President Obama to map out a blueprint for the development of China-U.S. relations and conduct cooperation across the Pacific Ocean," the Chinese president said.
Day becomes night before downpour in Beijing

The unusually laid-back summit between President Xi Jinping and US President Barack Obama, planned for Friday and Saturday, has given rise to expectations that an informal atmosphere will help the leaders of the world's two biggest economies tackle many simmering issues.

Between group meetings, they are expected to have some one-on-one time among the manicured gardens and walking paths at the estate.

Pig bodies scattered in an unlicensed slaughterhouse as the owners are busted by officials in Shenzhen, Guangdong Province, during a surprise inspection. It processed over 300 pigs daily before it was shut down.

Foreign learners practice Chinese martial arts movements at the Yuxu Palace on Wudang Mountain, known as a traditional center for the teaching and practice of martial arts, in central China's Hubei Province.
Chinese President Xi Jinping lays a wreath at the Altar of the Fatherland in Mexico City, capital of Mexico.
A China Airlines plane is dented from a bird-collision after departing Chengdu airport on Tuesday. The plane and its passengers were safely rerouted back after the incident.

An autistic child plays with her mother at Khon Kaen hospital in Khon Kaen, Thailand's northern province, June 3, 2013. Khon Kaen initiated a participation of medical staff in Khon Kaen hospital. Autistic children's parents and local schools produced a holistic package for autistic children. According to a report released by Thai autism experts, at least 200,000 children in the country suffer from autism, and the number is still growing.
NASA astronauts train in world's largest swimming pool

A worker pushes a cart full of boiled rice dumplings, or zongzi, at a food processing plant in Jiaxing, Zhejiang Province on Wednesday. The plant is now making some 1.5 million rice dumplings on a daily basis ahead of the Dragon Boat Festival, which falls on June 12 this year.

Visiting Chinese President Xi Jinping and his Mexican counterpart, Enrique Pena Nieto, pledged Tuesday to enhance political dialogue on bilateral, regional and global issues so as to consolidate the China-Mexico comprehensive strategic partnership.

In a joint statement, both leaders agreed to maintain frequent contacts between leaders of the two countries and to enhance exchange of visits by ministers in a bid to boost cooperation in various areas.

The Mexican side announced that its agriculture secretary will pay a working visit to China and attend the China-Latin America and the Caribbean agriculture ministers' forum in June. The tourism secretary will visit China in July.
Cyclists compete in stage three of Tour de Singkarak 2013 in West Sumatra, Indonesia. Hundreds of cyclists from 24 countries and regions participate in this annual cycling race.

Representatives of residents who got back their stolen bikes, including electric bikes, on Tuesday present pennants to local police in Huaxian county, Henan Province. In February, police caught a family of five from Changyuan county, who stole around 1,000 bikes in a crime spree lasting just under four years.
The superstructure of a third Japanese warship, the helicopter carrier ISE (DDH 182).

A Nepalese farmer winnows wheat after harvesting at Bhaktapur on the outskirts of Kathmandu on Monday. Over 80 percent of Nepal's 27 million people depend upon agriculture, with paddy as the major crop in the Himalayan nation. The GDP per capita in Nepal was last recorded at $619.45 in 2011.

Pakistani girls search for recyclable items from a garbage dump on the eve of World Environment Day in northwest Pakistan's Peshawar. The World Environment Day that falls on June 5 is celebrated by the United Nations to stimulate worldwide awareness of environmental issues and encourages political action.
Autistic children perform in a musical drama "A Tale of the Peach Blossom Spring" in Beijing. Dozens of autistic children from a rehabilitation Center demonstrated the effects of art therapy.

Huashan/Hua Mountain has a sky plank that was built 700 years ago. The wooden plank is so narrow that it only has 60cm. One can easily fall into the abyss if not be careful. Would you dare to have a try? JL
Chinese female naval soldiers start to implement combat duties

Participants march during a 2013 SlutWalk rally against sexual discrimination or inequality in Vancouver, Canada. Slutwalk is a movement across the world, calling for equal rights for sex and genders' respect, which was provoked after a policeman advised young women to "avoid dressing like sluts" in Canada in April 2011.

Chinese President Xi Jinping arrived Sunday for a state visit to Costa Rica with the purpose of promoting cooperation between the Asian giant and the Central American country.

Upon his arrival, Xi said Costa Rica is an important country in Central America and expanding bilateral cooperation is not only in line with the fundamental interests of the two nations but contributive to world peace and development.

Xi added that he looks forward to exchanging views with President Laura Chinchilla and other Costa Rican leaders on bilateral relations and other issues of common concern.

A woman looks over 3D-printed figures over the weekend at a recently opened 3D photo shop in Shanghai. The shop can produce miniatures of customers using 3D printing technology. A single 3D figure can cost over 1,000 yuan ($163).

A fisherman shows off an octopus in Qingdao, East China's Shandong Province on Saturday. With Saturday's start of the 3-month fishing ban that will run till September 1, seafood prices increased slightly. This year marks the 19th year that China has implemented the seasonal fishing ban, which has played an important role in ocean resource restoration and an increase in income for fishermen.

Members of the reunited Backstreet Boys take time out from their China tour to help feed baby pandas with bamboo and milk at Chengdu Research Base of Giant Panda Breeding in Southwest China's Sichuan province. The boys performed in Chengdu on May 31, 2013, their first concert in the city since they reunited.
A model presents a creation by Indonesian designer Ida Royani during Indonesia Islamic Fashion Fair in Jakarta, Indonesia. The event was held from May 30 to June 2.

Pakistanis march during a rally marking World No Tobacco Day in eastern Pakistan's Lahore. The World Health Organization (WHO) has called for a comprehensive ban on all tobacco advertising, promotion and sponsorship, saying that the tobacco companies' "aggressive marketing" has led to addiction killing at least 6 million people worldwide each year.

Kashmiri schoolgirls walk past Indian policemen as the police conduct a patrol in Srinagar on Thursday. Much of Kashmir has been put under curfew as protests and strikes over the recent hanging of Mohammed Afzal Guru for his part in attacks on the Indian parliament in 2001 have disrupted daily life.

The far-sea training taskforce under the North Sea Fleet of the Navy of the Chinese People's Liberation Army (PLA) continued training in the waters of the West Pacific for far-sea training on May 28, 2013.

Children play at an activity center in Lhasa, capital of southwest China's Tibet Autonomous Region, May 30, 2013. Various activities are held across China to celebrate the coming International Children's Day.

Children in rural areas: Fewer toys, more joy
Isn't every day the Children's Day for children in cities? They get their meals cooked, clothes washed, sheets changed, and toys, lots of toys but they never seem satisfied. In rural areas in China, the children whose parents have migrated to cities to make a living have fewer toys, but they have more joy.

A female giant panda, Shin Shin, eats bamboo in her cage at Tokyo's Ueno Zoo on Tuesday. Shin Shin has been showing signs of being pregnant, the zoo said. Shin Shin and her mate Ri Ri were confirmed to have mated in March, and Shin Shin's condition, such as her hormone level, suggests she may be pregnant.

The large art work of "The Sea of Hands" during the Reconciliation Week 2013 in the University of Sydney, Australia. The first "Sea of Hands" was held on Oct. 12, 1997, in Australia's capital of Canberra.

Children perform on a train from Yinchuan, capital of northwest China's Ningxia Hui Autonomous Region, to Beijing, capital of China. Children from the kindergarten of Ningxia University visited the train and held a performance to celebrate the upcoming Children's Day.
Chinese President Xi Jinping shakes hands with Zanzibar President Ali Mohamed Shein during their meeting in Beijing, capital of China.

A worker checks bricks of compressed tea at a factory in Menghai county, Yunnan province, on May 19. The province is a major tea producer and boasts a few national names such as Pu'er.

A few foreign tea experts believe tea could become increasingly popular at dinner tables around the world.

Promotion and marketing would be the key, said experts attending the 2013 International Tea Conference in Pu'er, Yunnan province, over the weekend

The No. 12 glacier in Laohugou Valley on the western section of the Qilian Mountain, northwest China's Gansu Province. It is longest glacier in the Qilian Mountain, and it has presented an apparent shrinkage due to the rising temperature.

Graduating cadets take their oath during the graduation ceremonies at the United States Military Academy at West Point, New York, the United States, May 25, 2013. 1,007 cadets graduated on Saturday from the famous military academy founded in 1802.
Live fire drill of PLA tanks

Players of China celebrate during the awarding ceremony after the final match against South Korea at the Sudirman Cup World Team Badminton Championships in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia, on May 26, 2013. Team China won the champion with 3-0.
A pair of couple take a self-portrait in a rape flower field in Beijing. Rape flower blossom in the outskirt of Beijing attracted city dwellers over the weekend.

A woman aged over 90 sits in her flooded house in Daba Village of Jiaoling County, Meizhou City, South China's Guangdong Province. Living apart from their son, the senior couple have to rely on themselves after the rainstorm hitting Guangdong Province on May 18. With the youth attending school or working outside their hometowns, the left-behind family members are becoming even more vulnerable after natural disasters

Giant Lego Star Wars X-Wing made appearance in New York's landmark Times Square. Made of more than 5.3 million bricks, weighs almost 46,000 pounds, the spaceship is the largest model ever made by Lego. It took 32 builders and 17,000 hours to construct.

China and Switzerland signed a Memorandum of Understanding at the conclusion of free trade talks on Friday during Premier Li Keqiang's visit to Bern, the Swiss capital, in what business leaders called a landmark deal.

The signing of the memorandum means Switzerland will soon become the first country in continental Europe and the first of the world's top 20 economies to reach such an agreement with China. The deal covers goods and services, environmental protection, intellectual property protection, market competition and labor protection.

China and Switzerland will announce the conclusion of talks over a free trade agreement (FTA), visiting Chinese Premier Li Keqiang said Friday.

In a speech delivered at a luncheon with business and financial leaders, Li said he will jointly make the announcement with Swiss President Ueli Maurer. The China-Switzerland FTA would have special significance, as it will be the first one to be signed between China and a country in continental Europe, Li noted.

It's been known that United Airlines staffs' manner is specifically worst towards Chinese passengers. And the way UA treated passenger Mr. Liu was offensive. Click to read more detail and decide yourself whether to take UA in the future or not.
http://usa.people.com.cn/n/2013/0522/c241376-21564657.html

A worker renders a protective spray onto the trophy of a cheetah at the TROPHÄENDIENSTE taxidermy factory, in the suburb of Windhoek, capital of Namibia. With a great variety of wildlife and developed hunting services, Namibia attracts hunters from all over the world who prefer to have their quarries made into trophies. With 22 years of experience in the business, TROPHÄENDIENSTE taxidermy factory in the suburb of Windhoek caters for all the needs of trophy-hunters, bring the dead animals to life again with its taxidermy techniques.

U.S.-China Economic Relations in the Next Decade
A conference was held in Manhattan on Tuesday focusing on the future economic relations between China and the US. Henry Kissinger, Former US Secretary of State, and C.H. Tung, Former Chief Executive and President of the Executive Council of Hong Kong were among the speakers.

The speakers discussed potential areas for increased bilateral cooperation, the most beneficial ways forward for both countries, and projections of what can be achieved from a continued economic relationship in 2022 — the 50th anniversary of President Richard Nixon's visit to China.

A beekeeper checks his bees Tuesday in Yantai, East China's Shandong Province. Yantai boasts many sophora flowers in May, when beekeepers from across the country go to the city as the flowers are in full bloom. Each beehive can produce about 20 kilos of honey each year and honey is sold at around 60 yuan ($9.78) per kilo, meaning beekeepers can earn 1,200 yuan for each hive annually. China produced 431,000 tons of honey in 2011, the latest data from the National Bureau of Statistics showed

A South Korean model poses with the world's first curved OLED TV, made by LG Electronics, during the World IT Show 2013 in Seoul. South Korea's largest consumer electronics and technology trade fair kicked off on Tuesday, showcasing the latest mobile gadgets and telecommunications technologies.

Wang Yanghu, 44, a principal from Xi'an, Shaanxi, reviews with his students on Monday, 18 days before the national college entrance examination. Wang, who has successfully signed up for the exams, is the first exam-escort principal in the country.

Little past the midnight, a naked young man is always seen in Beijing running around. Sometimes he's seen riding a motorcycle, naked. He's also seen carrying a mannequin while running, naked. This naked male was graduated from an art college. He'd feel restless and lost when his artistic mind is bottlenecked. Naked running relieves him. JL

China has built the world's tallest Buddha with a total investment of around 1 billion. In May 2007, the State Bureau of Religious Affairs approved the launch of the Donglin Buddha project in Jiujiang City, Jiangxi Province. The Buddha is made of 48 kilograms of gold. The funds of this project come from worldwide believers' donation.

An 18-year-old Indian teen has made a ravlutionary invention: a 20-second phone charger. The super-capacitor device can charge a phone in less than 20 seconds. Eesha Khare was awarded the Young Scientist Award by the Intel Foundation. The award granted her US$50,000.

An excerpt of Visiting Chinese Premier Li Keqiang's signed article published in India.
 
Both China and India are big countries in size and in population. Together, the populations of our two countries exceed 2.5 billion and account for nearly 40 percent of the world's total. We are viewed as the two most important emerging markets. However, our bilateral trade volume was less than 70 billion U.S. dollars last year. This is incompatible with the strength and status of our two countries, but it also points to the huge potential for expanding and upgrading our bilateral trade and business cooperation. This is an issue that the two sides must work to resolve together.
 

The article was published on Monday titled A Handshake Across the Himalayas in The Hindu, an English-language Indian daily, and Dainik Jagran, the largest read daily in India. Click to read the full text of the article: http://usa.people.com.cn/n/2013/0521/c241376-21549157.html

China and India issued a joint statement Monday highlighting their commitment to expanding common ground in bilateral cooperation and coordination in various fields.

The statement, released during Chinese Premier Li Keqiang's ongoing visit, said the two Asian giants have a historic opportunity for economic and social development and the realization of this goal will advance peace and prosperity in Asia and the world at large.

"The two sides welcome each other's peaceful development and regard it as a mutually reinforcing process," said the document. "There is enough space in the world for the development of China and India, and the world needs the common development of both countries."

While striving to realize the trade turnover target of 100 billion U.S. dollars by 2015, the two countries agreed to take measures to address the issue of the trade imbalance, including cooperation in pharmaceutical supervision and completion of phytosanitary negotiations on agro-products.

Huge QR code lawn that plays music in Hefei, Anhui Province
A huge lawn with a 2-dimensional bar code is seen at a construction site in Hefei, Anhui Province, May 16, 2013. The lawn, about 6,400 square meters, can be decoded by smartphone apps from above to play music and videos.

Tourists visit the Hagia Sophia in Istanbul on May 18, 2013. On International Museum Day, several national museums of Turkey were free in a limited time for the tourists and public to visit. Hagia Sophia is one of the most visited museums and most prominent monuments in the world in terms of art and the history of architecture. It was used as a church for 916 years and following the conquest of Istanbul by Fatih Sultan Mehmed, the Hagia Sophia was converted into mosque.

A model presents a Bugatti Veyron at the 2013 China (Taiyuan) International Automobile Exhibition in Taiyuan, capital of north China's Shanxi Province. Some 400 vehicles of 63 brands were taken to the auto show here, which kicked off on May 16.
Egrets feed their chicks at the Xiangshan forest park located in Xinjian County, east China's Jiangxi Province. As summer came, tens of thousands of egrets have nested in the park to breed.

Birds gather at Qinghai Lake in Xining City, northwest China's Qinghai Province, May 10, 2013. Vedio monitoring system and database platforms were established here since 2005, monitoring the epidemic situation of migratory birds.

PLA 1st female special operation company conduct parachute training

A 15-member squad of female commandos successfully completed a parachuting drill in north China on Tuesday, according to the People's Liberation Army.

Bailuo people celebrate their traditional "Qiaocai Festival" in southwest China's Yunnan Province. The Bailuo people living in Wenshan is a subline of the Yi ethnic group. The Qiaocai Festival, one of the Bailuo people's most important festival, was celebrated at Chengzhai Village on Tuesday. During the festival, the Bailuo people dress in their folk costumes and perform their traditional dancing.
Working staff trim the hair of pet dogs at a store in east China's Zhejiang Province. Pet dogs' hair was cut short as the hot summer is approaching.

Police admit to failure in Zhu poisoning

Beijing police said Wednesday that they had failed to solve a poisoning case in which Tsinghua University student Zhu Lingling, formerly known as Zhu Ling, was paralyzed 19 years ago, due to the lack of evidence needed to convict the suspect. This caused netizens to call on the police to make public the investigation results.

This is also the first time that local police have ever responded to a public request for reinvestigating the case, in which Zhu's roommate, Sun Wei, was alleged to have orchestrated the poisoning.

New Republic: The 20-Year-Old Crime That's Blowing Up on Chinese Social Media (http://www.newrepublic.com/article/113116/zhu-ling-attempted-murder-case-weibo )
On May 4, the popular Chinese actress Yao Chen posted the following message to her 45 million followers on the microblogging site Sina Weibo: "Nineteen years ago, the young Zhu Ling was poisoned. Nineteen years later, this name has again been poisoned."

The saga goes back to 1994, when Zhu Ling, a pretty and able chemistry student at China's prestigious Tsinghua University, was poisoned by thallium. Zhu Ling survived, but remains paralyzed and dependent on her parents for care. Nobody knows for sure why she was poisoned, and nobody has been convicted of the crime. Of course, Chinese netizens have formed their own opinions. Many have long believed that Sun Wei, Zhu Ling's roommate and only major suspect in the case got off scot free because her uncle and grandfather were powerful communist officials. For many Chinese, this just confirms a widespread belief that officials are above the law.

Why are the babies in beggars' arms always sleeping?

In New York City, haggard women can often be seen begging for money with a baby. And most of the time, the toddler is sleeping. Have you ever wondered why?

It is been widely known that these beggars are controlled by a highly structuralized organization. But what mysterious is the slumbering kids in their arms. One day, a reporter saw a beggar with an infant sitting near a subway entrance. The reporter approached her and asked what happened to the baby, but the woman just waved him away. The reporter stayed there and watched them for the whole day, but the baby never woke up, nor did it move. Later that evening, a vehicle came and drove the woman and the baby away. The baby was still in coma. 

The next day, the reporter saw the same beggar sitting on the same spot as yesterday, only that she was holding another baby. Again, it looked as if it was sleeping. The reporter asked what happened to the baby yesterday, and why this baby was sleeping. The woman just kept silence. Sensing that there was something wrong, the reporter alerted the police. But by the time the police arrived, both the woman and the baby were gone.

A drug addict later told the reporter that the people behind this operation feed the babies heroin and vodka every day before they were brought to streets. This is to prevent them from crying and making noises when the adults are begging for money. The drug addict also said that toddlers under age 3 appear to be particularly vulnerable to such strong substances; many of them died few hours after they are fed. And the beggar still needs to hold the body in her arms as if it's sleeping for the whole day.

The people behind this operation are awfully cruel and cold-blooded. They exploit our compassions and brutally use babies as their money maker.

If you happen to see beggars like this on the street, don't give them money, because your money will only encourage the organization's growth, which will in turn kill more infants.

New York Office of People's Daily Online Are Hiring 
People's Daily Online USA Inc. is seeking  video news producer and editor.
Position: Video news producer
Job Description：　　
1、Follow current affairs in the USA, plan and select interview topics or field news topics from the perspectives of Chinese readers, produce outlines;
2、Propose candidates for interviews and make appointments with them;
3、Host interviews;
4、Shoot field news. 
Qualifications:
- Working experience in media. 
- Interested in China issues and some knowledge of China.
- Working language is English. Chinese is not a must-have requirement.
- Skill of using non-linear video editing software is not required but considered an additional asset.

Position: Video news editor
Job Description：　　
1、Under the guidance of the producer, shooting video interviews and field news;
2、Propose interview topics or field news topics;
3、Edit the video interviews and field news;
4、Other related work.
Qualifications:
- High skill of using video cameras and non-linear video editing software. 
- Interested in China issues and some knowledge of China.
- Working language is English, Chinese is considered an additional asset.
Apply Instructions:
Send your application to email "USA at peopledaily.com.cn", or mail to the address below . Please include a resume, cover letter and working samples or provide us with links to the materials in publication.
About us:
People's Daily Online USA Inc. is subsidiary to People's Daily Online Corp. and was registered in New York State in September 2010.
